results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships

 

 


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

results.description:
Admission to the museum is $12

Maybe afterwards we can grab food somewhere nearby. Post your suggestions in the comments!

Aaron Rodriguez will be holding a live animal show at the Morbid Anatomy Museum. Most of his animal specimens are insects, but also include arachnids, reptiles, amphibians and fish, all of which are harmless. The event will be an informal show-and-tell, a Q & A session where guests can touch and hold the animals while Aaron answer whatever questions they may have. People can also gather around to take pictures or videos of the animals. 

This event is a celebration of animals and their many different shapes, sizes and behaviors. This particularly applies to the animals we refer to as "bugs" or "creepy crawlies," animals that are normally misunderstood and, as a result, feared. Aaron Rodriguez's goal is for people to become open to the idea that even creatures like cockroaches and spiders get undeserved hatred. He will supervise guests and give them guidelines to properly handle his pets in a way that is positive for both the humans and the animals. 

Aaron Rodriguez grew up in the Bronx, New York and is currently a Masters student in Biology at New York University. As a growing profession he performs live animal shows throughout New York and New Jersey, educational show-and-tells where people can interact with and ask questions about animals. These shows are meant to inform people about animals in their many shapes, sizes and behaviors. This particularly applies to animals that are normally feared or misunderstood, such as insects and spiders. His goal is to ultimately enter a Ph.D. program in Entomology, or the study of insects, while continuing to do educational shows.
results.name: Insect, Arachnids and Reptiles Petting Zoo with NYU Biology Student

results.description:
Join us for an event that's organized by our friends from GDG Newark. They're running an event entitled "Grokking Realm - A New Mobile Database." They'll be hosted by Audible in their downtown Newark office. The talk will be given by Donn Felker, a Google Developer Expert on Android.

Abstract: Learn about the new mobile database on the block, Realm. With Realm you work with regular Java objects - not SQL, cursors or object mappers. These same Java objects are native to Realm. Learn how to use Realm and its reactive features to build apps faster and more efficiently without having to write a line of SQL. You'll leave with a firm understanding of how to install, setup, store and retrieve data with a Realm database. When you get back to the office you can use Realm to help you focus on solving a business problem instead of worrying about how to get your data in and out of a database.

Pizza and beer will be provided by Audible!

Audible Inc.
1 Washington Place, Newark, NJ, 15th Floor (map)

How to get here:
1. Mass transit

Take Path trains or NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station > Take the Newark Light rail to Washington Park or look for the Audible shuttle outside the main entrance (every 10-20 minutes)

or

Take NJ Transit to Newark Broad Street > walk to 1 Washington Park.

2. Drive

Parking will be free at the main lot. Just say you're here for Audible. Any overflow can park at a paid parking lot close to the building.

Join Be Social Change on Monday, February 29th from 7-9 PM for Advanced Networking Skills: Unlock Your Authentic Self to Create Better Personal Presentations with Minna Taylor, Founder of Energizeyourvoice.net.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCNetworkFeb29

===========================================

The power of a first impression is vital to how well we connect with others as well as build our network to create new career and business opportunities. How we are perceived plays a major role in our ability to move forward in any relationship. All too often, however, the perception we have of ourselves and the perception others have of us do not match up. Where is the disconnect? How do we bridge the gap?

In this class you will come to understand how to create great first impressions and evaluate your success through a three-point system of analysis, utilizing a shared vocabulary for evaluation. Utilizing improvisation, group exploration, and individual analysis, you will walk away empowered with deeper self-awareness and tools for how to represent yourself authentically in any networking situation.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN:

• Discover how others perceive you and know the impression you are giving to the world.

• Perception is subjective. With this in mind, we will learn universal tips for making a great first impression - openness, generosity, curiosity, and clarity of intention.

• Understand basics of eye contact, body language, and vocal tone.

• Learn through watching - develop skills for how to understand yourself and others with more precision, awareness, and authenticity.

• Skills for active listening.


WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR:

• Professionals, entrepreneurs, creative innovators, salespeople, fundraisers, non-profits, marketers, designers, tech startups

• Individuals interested in personal growth and development.

• Professionals who have an idea for a project, organization or business that will drive change.


INSTRUCTOR BIO:

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/iJB0DLwblsOybyaC79ymz-4PVwhilHXNXNfzK_OwiVNc7T60Ac6CFvbUtDLNRvEl1OvPYD-JUQVWwxzU8TU8uDa9fYiqhSMSHmnQqmXeoF74b9YDfACxD-hO1JgXJ2thPGSAe39s

Founder and CEO of Energizeyourvoice.net, Minna Taylor has been empowering individuals and professionals in the area of effective communication since 2006. Her approach is grounded in establishing and maintaining focus and intention through a foundation of effective breathing and physical engagement - balancing investment in play and practicality.

She works with professionals to re-inspire curiosity and a sense of play, enhancing their investment and engagement in their work.  Her main points of instruction for professional clients are Public Speaking, Presentation Skills, and Accent Reduction.  She also teaches improv based presentation and team building workshops to corporations. She has worked with CEOs of major corporations all over the world, educators, creatives, and entrepreneurs.

Individual and personal coaching is geared toward helping everyday people find their voice and speak their truth from a centered and present space.  She works with couples, groups, and one-on-one. She has partnered with match makers, divorce lawyers, women's organizations, and community groups.

Minna earned her BFA in acting from NYU Tisch in association with The Atlantic Theater Company and her MFA in theater from Brooklyn College, CUNY with a concentration in speech and voice.  Her background in performance has built a skill set unique to guiding people into finding their truth, exploring presence, and using their voice for authentic communication.

You can learn about her current work here www.energizeyourvoice.net and more about her background here https://www.linkedin.com/in/minna-taylor-35a19618

SPACE PARTNER  

</a>

The Centre for Social Innovation (<a href="http://www.twitter.com/csiSL">@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/


Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.

Abstract: If you are thinking about RC toys such as airplanes, cars, and the like, you are in the wrong place, sorry.

Have you ever wished you could access that computer in the basement office from the upstairs bedroom from your smartphone, tablet or laptop? There are many ways to do this (cloud-based or not, over the open internet or a VPN connection, ...). We will cover some of the pros and cons of the different approaches and focus specifically on a cross-platform tool, free for personal use, called TeamViewer. Actual use of the application will be demonstrated.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

Learn to improve your photography through a gentle and honest interactive online photo critique led by professional photographer, Vickie Lewis. 

Please join our meeting in a google hangout. Here is the link: https://plus.google.com/events/cn73nh84cileditcc8v3m364c70.

The very best way to take your photography to the next level is to get personal feedback. These critiques are a great place to feel safe, talk about your work and get constructive feedback.

"Fantastic! I was nervous about having my photos critiqued, but Vickie offered suggestions with gentleness and respect. It wasn't painful at all! Listening to her feedback, I had a great "ah-ha" moment about what I need to do to take my work to the next level. I'm so grateful to have had this opportunity to personally interact with a respected and experienced professional at such a bargain price. I will definitely do it again if the opportunity comes around again!

Vickie has been a full-time professional photographer and editor for over 30 years and has shot over 150 portraits for People Magazine. Her work is represented by The National Geographic image collection. 

To assure personal attention during the critiques, we are going to limit the number of photographers being critiqued to five. Photographers being critiqued will be able to interact with Vickie and get their questions answered. 

We’ll using gotomeeting.com. It requires downloading a viewer on your computer. I will post the link to go meeting before December 10th. 

I've been doing critiques for a long time and realize that just listening can be educational too and so we are inviting all our Meetup group members to view the critiques for free.

The first five photographers who sign up to be critiqued will send 8-10 photos via email. Send your best, a recent shoot or something that didn't come out the way you thought it would and we'll help figure out what could have been done differently. Due to time limitations, we probably won’t critiqued all the photos each photographer submits, but we like to have a selection to look at to help you improve. We will make sure those who choose to participate get personal attention.

It doesn't matter what your skill level is, we have beginners and advanced and everyone learns something!

If you’d like to have your photos critiqued, the price is $25 per person. 

Go to this link to sign up:

http://www.vickielewis.com/online_photo_critiques/

What past participants have said about critiques:

"I enjoyed the webinar and it was very informative. It made me look at my photos in a different way along with understanding focal point. I would take another webinar with Vickie. Thank you." 

"I enjoyed this session very much. Vickie has such a good eye it's amazing! There was a nice balance between recommendations for improvement and pointing out what was good. We saw some outstanding photos, I hope the other photographers will post some of them." 

“Once again, our group provided a rewarding way to learn. Each one of our members showed interesting photographs, along with unique approaches to the subject matter. Vickie gave us valuable feedback, and it was the feedback that we all needed. If you want to belong to a social and educational photo Meetup, try this one!”

“A very enjoyable evening. I learned a lot!”

“Great evening! It was good to see everyone and I enjoyed everyone's work. It very helpful to me get reactions from other folks to improve my pictures.

“So interesting to see how cropping can move a photo from good to wow! A thoroughly enjoyable evening. Thanks for such an enjoyable discussion.”

Great feedback! Great to see other photographer's work and viewpoints.

“All, thank you for a great experience and the great suggestions. I'm using them already and got many new ideas from all the wonderful photos.”

“As usual, I was impressed and inspired by everyone's photos. I also picked up a couple new tips, so it was a great night!”

“Thank you all for a wonderful evening! Beautiful photos, great tips and a great group! Hope to attend another informative session :)”

results.description:
February's book is White Teeth by Zadie Smith!


Epic and intimate, hilarious and poignant, White Teeth is the story of two North London families—one headed by Archie Jones, the other by Archie's best friend, a Muslim Bengali named Samad Iqbal. Pals since they served together in World War II, Archie and Samad are a decidedly unlikely pair. Plodding Archie is typical in every way until he marries Clara, a beautiful, toothless Jamaican woman half his age, and the couple have a daughter named Irie (the Jamaican word for "no problem"). Samad —devoutly Muslim, hopelessly "foreign"— weds the feisty and always suspicious Alsana in a prearranged union. They have twin sons named Millat and Magid, one a pot-smoking punk-cum-militant Muslim and the other an insufferable science nerd. The riotous and tortured histories of the Joneses and the Iqbals are fundamentally intertwined, capturing an empire's worth of cultural identity, history, and hope.


Friendly reminders that a) there is a $2 fee collected upon arrival and b) any & all suggestions for future books are always welcome! Leave a comment here and/or message me directly with ideas; I keep a running list and will send out another poll later in the spring. :)
results.name: February Meetup -- White Teeth

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 1 and 2: "Foods Power" & "Our Culture's Roots"

• Chapter 1: Food's Power; "The most violent weapon on earth is the fork".  [Gandhi] What does food mean to us in our busy culture? It is the most intimate thing we do. How can something so pedestrian be so powerful? 

• Chapter 2: Our culture's Roots; "As long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other. He who sows the seeds of murder and pain cannot reap joy and love" [Pythagoras] How did we get here, to a culture that is so meat obsessed, yet cannot bare to see how our food is harvested. Where did we depart from our innate and childlike sense of compassion toward animals.

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural well-being, economic well-being, and alignment with our ethical and spiritual values.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, seeking clarity on more challenging sections through open discussion, and sharing how you have been effected by your food choices.

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor to the deep discussions that will inevitably come from discussing the text.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.

results.description:
Full title: FX Option Performance - An Analysis of the Value Delivered by FX Options Since the Start of the Market (The Wiley Finance Series) (Amazon book order here)

Abstract: Get the little known yet crucial facts about FX options

Daily turnover in FX options is an estimated U.S. $ 207 billion, but many fundamental facts about this huge and liquid market are generally unknown. FX Option Performance provides the information practitioners need to be more effective in the market, with detailed, specific guidance.

This book is a unique and practical guide to option trading, with the courage to report how much these contracts have really made or lost. Breaking free from the typical focus on theories and generalities, this book gets specific travelling back in history to show exactly how options performed in different markets and thereby helping investors and hedgers alike make more informed decisions. Not overly technical, the rigorous approach remains accessible to anyone with an interest in the area, showing investors where to look for value and helping corporations hedge their FX exposures. FX Option Performance begins with a quick and practical introduction to the FX option market, then provides specific advice toward structures, performance, rate fluctuation, and trading strategies.

• Examine the historical payoffs to the most popular and liquidly traded options
• Learn which options are overvalued and which are undervalued
• Discover surprising, generally unpublished facts about emerging markets
• Examine systemic option trading strategies to find what works and what doesn′t

On average, do options result in profit, loss, or breaking even? How can corporations more cost–effectively hedge their exposure to emerging markets? Are cheap out–of–the–money options worth it?

Speaker: Professor Jessica James is Senior Quantitative Researcher at Commerzbank in London. She joined Commerzbank from Citigroup where she held a number of FX roles, latterly as Global Head of the Quantitative Investor Solutions Group.

Prior to this she was the Head of Risk Advisory and Currency Overlay for Bank One. Before her career in finance, James lectured in physics at Trinity College, Oxford.

Her significant publications include the ‘Handbook of Foreign Exchange’ (Wiley), 'Interest Rate Modelling' (Wiley), and 'Currency Management' (Risk books). Her new book ‘FX Option Performance’ was published in May 2015.

She has been closely associated with the development of currency as an asset class, being one of the first to create overlay and currency alpha products.

Jessica is a Managing Editor for the Journal of Quantitative Finance, and is a Visiting Professor both at UCL and at Cass Business School.

Apart from her financial appointments, she is a Fellow of the Institute of Physics and has been a member of their governing body and of their Industry and Business Board.
results.name: Seminar (London) - Jessica James - Trading FX Options

results.description:
Community Circling Nights have a lively and supportive atmosphere and are intended to bring community together in a group setting to experience each other and different facilitators in one evening.

The evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm for BOTH Experienced Circlers and Newcomers

$25 paid in-advance online
$30 at the door

To Register: http://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

Times below are approximate:

7:30 pm - Group Connection and Check-Ins
7:50 - Newcomers Learning Session
7:50 - Experienced Circlers break into circles
8:35 - Break
8:50 - Circle 2 (mixing new and experienced circlers)
9:30 - Break
9:40 - Circling 3 (mixing new and experienced circlers)
10:20 - Closing exercise
10:25 - announcements

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7:30 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Community Circling Nights will be facilitated by trained Circlers

If you can't make it to a Community Circling Night, join us at a Circling Lab, a smaller more intimate experience occuring weekly Mondays at Reflections: http://circling.eventbrite.com/

March 7 - Experienced Circlers
March 14 - Beginner Circlers 6:30, Everyone Else 7:30
March 21 - Experienced Circlers
March 28 - Community Circling Night

Community Circling Nights:
$25 Advance Payment online
$30 At the door
> PRE-PAY HERE: http://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com


REGISTER HERE: http://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

$25 In-advance online
$30 At the door

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at: [masked]

Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Join us for Monday evening inspiration! We'll share a writing prompt and refreshments at Cuppa Pulp Writers' Space. Led by Donna Miele or Writing Beyond the Basic's Jean Marie Donnelly. 

Evening write! easily accommodates both poetry or prose, but we do try to gear prompts toward helping writers explore elements of longer-term projects, most often character development, setting development, and narrative voice. Although the salon focuses on generating new work, discussion often naturally incorporates issues we face when working on longer pieces.

We will continue to schedule Monday evening write! regardless of attendance, but will cancel if less than three writers have RSVP'd. (That means that if it's just going to be the leader and one other writer, we will cancel.) So don't forget to RSVP at least one day in advance if you intend to come!

See detailed directions here. Hope to see you!

Monday evenings, from 7:30pm to 9:00pm, you are welcome to Renaissance at Neolyth, a gathering for all to share with and support one another, promoting curiosity and growth toward new horizons of thought. This is a chance to share what you are studying, seeking, yearning after. Members in turn present for 5 minutes on something new one has learned or a piece of art one has created. Each month, one book will be suggested for group discussion, and members may suggest books as well. We are all our own teachers and likewise artists in each our actions. You decide (and have decided) what deserves your attention. You carry curiosity to its ends. Have you wondered how far it can go? Come join us and see.

Tejas Potyński will be your host for the evening. He is a student currently on hiatus from schooling. He attended the University of California, Merced, where he studied English literature and writing. He spent a year studying abroad in Berlin, focusing on the German language and philosophy.

facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description:

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

VERY IMPORTANT:

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


“Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play.

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:

* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

TAP a KEG

2731 Broadway

New York, NY 10025

Betwee[masked]th and Broadway

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

Hi everyone,

We’re excited to offer members of the CH & LC Concertgoers tickets to an evening of choral music at Carnegie Hall on Monday, February 29th at 8:00pm!

The concert will feature the Masterworks Festival Chorus in a performance of Leonard Bernstein's masterpiece, Chichester Psalms at Carnegie Hall. Guest conductor Lynda Hasseler will also lead the chorus in Trinity Te Deum by Eriks Ešenvalds. 

Guest conductor Keith Hampton will lead the National Festival Chorus in a selection of shorter works including his timeless arrangements of "Praise His Holy Name" and "Hold On!" 

The concert will also feature debut performances by Capital University Chapel Choir under the direction of Lynda Hasseler, and North Central University Chorale, conducted by Larry Bach.

Join us at world-renowned Carnegie Hall for this fantastic evening of choral music!

**Tickets are only $7 each, a great discount (value: $110 for Parquet seating)! You can purchase your ticket(s) directly on this event page. Please note: Once you have booked your tickets, they will be available for collection under your full name (the name listed under your PayPal "Buyer Information" in payment, not your Meetup name) at the box office at Carnegie Hall as early as 4pm on the day of the performance. 

Each individual is responsible for picking up his or her own tickets. Everyone from our Meetup group will be seated together. 

Remember, since this is an exclusive club, we ask that you do not contact the box office at Carnegie Hall. Please contact me with any questions regarding your tickets.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

results.description:
Practitioners of Orgasmic Meditation believe the sexual impulse is the most powerful fuel on the planet, and when harnessed, this most basic human instinct can drive both individual and collective change.

The challenge to date is that this energy is so volatile, not unlike nuclear energy. What we have discovered is that when this energy is harnessed in the context of a practice, you can use it safely and get sustainable results. In our quest to explore the full potential inherent in the human condition, orgasm is the nutrient that feeds the process of consciousness evolution. Since Orgasmic Meditation is a partnered practice, this evolution is no longer an isolated process accessible to selected few. Awakening becomes a rewarding and connected experience driven by our bodies, not our minds.

Orgasm sheds light on our shadow and reveals how our perfection integrates shame, insecurities, and the past. A path of consciousness powered by Orgasm continuously unfolds an invitation to play and transmute, to rediscover and forgive ourselves, to drop dynamics and ideas that no longer serve us and to recover from disconnection and lay the foundation of our own power.

About Rachel Tayeb
“I wouldn’t be here if it weren’t for Rachel” is one of the most common things long-time students and teachers of Orgasmic Meditation say when asked about Rachel Tayeb. A decade-long practitioner of OM, Rachel is a powerhouse of a woman. Electric, sharp, and clear-sighted, she takes a stand for wake-up in a world of asleep and never relents. A precision dismantler of her own mind, Rachel was once a Substance Abuse Counsellor helping alcoholics and addicts find a higher power and get sober. She can be found behind the scenes always, tinkering with the subconscious and unravelling energetic knots in herself and her clients. Once she’s taken you on, you’re never really outside the reach of her heart again. She’s fiercely loyal and uncompromisingly loving. She calls out every incongruent location she finds and her quality of attention often first confronts people, and then has them be able to trust her deeply, because she is quintessentially her true self in every location, every situation, in every group, with every friend.

Doors close for the evening at 8:15pm. Please arrive by 8pm.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10 Contact Margot for questions or more information[masked]
results.name: Orgasm as a path of consciousness:  with Rachel Tayeb

results.description:
Have you tried losing weight and improving your health on your own to no avail? Or it worked for a few weeks and then fell to pieces? It's time to actually make it happen - let's go into the Spring feeling lighter, more energetic, happier, and ready to enjoy life.

Take a look at the 3 month group program I set up and hear a few of my client stories all the way below...

(please note: you don't have to RSVP on MeetUp, instead register for the group here: http://goo.gl/forms/wlXJQyq7wQ)

WHAT EXACTLY IS THE PROGRAM?

It’s a 3 month gay men’s weight-loss and wellness group that starts on February 21st lead by me, Jon Fischer, a men's nutrition and lifestyle coach. It will be practical, easy-to-follow, and we’ll have a heck of a lot of fun while we're at it.

It will be an inspiring group of guys who all want to take the small, practical, sustainable steps toward improving their health and lifestyle - and I want you to be a part of it.

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN THE GROUP?

I understand that focusing on yourself and your own health can be annoying and frustrating. I’ve been there, too. From working with dozens of men as a coach, I know us guys tend to fall short in three areas: they tend to over-think things, they forget to celebrate their progress, they give-up after one mistake or misstep, or they just don't know where to start.

Sound familiar? Let's avoid all of that this time around.

That's why this group will be different - we will vigorously celebrate and we’ll focus on small, practical steps. So, if you’re looking to lose 5 pounds or 50 pounds, or if you know you should be doing more for your health in terms of improving sleep, relaxing more, making better food choices, and moving around a little more than you have been, this group is for you.

Join us and be part of something inspiring and fun. I guarantee the experience will be invaluable.

I’m getting excited just thinking about it! Aren’t you?


THE BENEFITS WILL INCLUDE:

• SUSTAINABLE WEIGHT LOSS so you lose it and keep it off (no more yo-yo dieting)

• GETTING QUALITY SLEEP so you start you day off right

• NATURALLY DE-STRESSING so making good food choices becomes easier...plus it will strengthen your relationships at work and at home

• REGAINING ENERGY & STAMINA to increase productivity and enjoy activities you love (including sex!)

• FINDING FUN WAYS TO MOVE YOUR BODY that fit your schedule and preference

• LEARNING TO MAKE QUICK & EASY RECIPES to save $$ while still eating well


WHAT WILL THE 3 MONTH PROGRAM ENTAIL?

• First off, the guidance and expertise of a men’s nutrition and lifestyle coach (me!)

•  Bi-weekly 50 minute group calls (6 total) where we’ll C-E-L-E-B-R-A-T-E together, learn more tips and techniques, and plan for the following weeks.

• A private FaceBook support group set up just for our program, where you can share you thoughts, concerns, victories, and ask me questions (just no animal or baby videos, OK?). It will also be a place for me to share all of my resources and encouragement with you.

• Fun bonus gifts! It’s gotta be fun or else it's not worth it.


PROGRAM COST

• The full program is $500 but I’m giving a few discounts only for this MeetUp group - because you guys kick ass...seriously. Payments will be made via PayPal so you can use your credit card.

OPTION #1: pay one time up front for a total of $300 (save 25%+) *best option*

OPTION #2: you can pay 3 monthly installments of $110

HERE’S HOW TO SIGN UP

All you have to do is click here to fill out the program registration questionnaire. Once that’s filled out, I’ll send you a PayPal request based on your payment option & savings and I’ll send you all the remaining details you’ll need. It’s quick and simple.

Remember, if you sign up by February 7th, you save an additional $50.

Let’s have fun and see wonderful results together. There are only 6 spots available - reserve your spot today for a healthier and happier future you today at http://goo.gl/forms/4...

ON THE FENCE? I TOTALLY GET IT. HEAR FIRSTHAND FROM A FEW CLIENTS

“With all these changes, my weight has dropped, my blood work as of last week was perfect, I have tons of energy from 7 AM – 11 PM, I feel really good and for the first time in more than 20 years, I am happy...

I encourage anyone on the fence (like I was) to get off and give Jon the chance to improve your overall life as he did mine.” - Randy, 50, Buffalo, NY

"I lost 15 pounds, my digestion is in a better place, I discovered new foods and ways of saving money on eating and just plain had fun.” - Dan, 46, Brooklyn, NY

"I’m much more in tune with my body. I know what it needs food-wise, when I’ve been idle too long and need activity, and I have a better overall attitude about body image.” - Chris, 29, Vancouver, BC

These guys kicked ass and had fun. They prove that good health doesn’t have to be boring and grueling.  I desperately want the same for you. Plus I want you to save $50, so sign up today by clicking here.

.
results.name: Gay Men's WeightLoss & Wellness Group Program (3 months)

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

We had our first meetup here last week and it was great! The space is perfect for drawing; there is a separate room with tables, stage and lights. I will upload photos soon so you can see it! 

There is no mandatory cover charge for this event, but there is a highly recommended $10 donation for the model. Any and all donations are warmly appreciated, and go towards keeping Drink & Draw running with the greatest models. 

7:30 - 10pm 

Monday, February 29th

at The Well, 272 Meserole Street

From the facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/DrinkandDrawatPassengerBar/

Drink & Draw with Ani is a casual life drawing series in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. We have a diverse set of lovely, experienced models who pose for you while you sip drinks and connect over this shared creative experience. 
Drawing is an exercise that is fun and good for your mental health- you don't need to be a 'professional' artist attend; we provide crayons and printer paper, or bring your own materials to maximize your creativity. This is also a great way to meet like-minded people in a casual, friendly setting in NYC.

“I wouldn’t be here if it weren’t for Rachel” is one of the most common things long-time students and teachers of Orgasmic Meditation say when asked about Rachel Tayeb. A decade-long practitioner of OM, Rachel is a powerhouse of a woman. Electric, sharp, and clear-sighted, she takes a stand for wake-up in a world of asleep and never relents. A precision dismantler of her own mind, Rachel was once a Substance Abuse Counsellor helping alcoholics and addicts find a higher power and get sober. She can be found behind the scenes always, tinkering with the subconscious and unravelling energetic knots in herself and her clients. Once she’s taken you on, you’re never really outside the reach of her heart again. She’s fiercely loyal and uncompromisingly loving. She calls out every incongruent location she finds and her quality of attention often first confronts people, and then has them be able to trust her deeply, because she is quintessentially her true self in every location, every situation, in every group, with every friend.

Doors close for the evening at 8:15pm. Please arrive by 8pm.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10 

Contact Margot for questions or more information

results.description:
Practitioners of Orgasmic Meditation believe the sexual impulse is the most powerful fuel on the planet, and when harnessed, this most basic human instinct can drive both individual and collective change.

The challenge to date is that this energy is so volatile, not unlike nuclear energy. What we have discovered is that when this energy is harnessed in the context of a practice, you can use it safely and get sustainable results. In our quest to explore the full potential inherent in the human condition, orgasm is the nutrient that feeds the process of consciousness evolution. Since Orgasmic Meditation is a partnered practice, this evolution is no longer an isolated process accessible to selected few. Awakening becomes a rewarding and connected experience driven by our bodies, not our minds. The practice is available for couples, or singles. You do not need to come with a partner. 

Orgasm sheds light on our shadow and reveals how our perfection integrates shame, insecurities, and the past. A path of consciousness powered by Orgasm continuously unfolds an invitation to play and transmute, to rediscover and forgive ourselves, to drop dynamics and ideas that no longer serve us and to recover from disconnection and lay the foundation of our own power.

Join in on NYSR Summer Distance Reiki Shares!

Boost your work week! RSVP to participate in the NYSR Distance Reiki Shares! With “Right Mind and Intention”, Distance Reiki sessions are as effective as sessions conducted in person.


These Summer Reiki Shares are a group effort of Practitioners who collaborate for the benefit of healing, supporting our personal lives, and enhancing the development of Reiki Skills, including sensitivity to giving and receiving Reiki.

AND YOU CAN DO THIS FROM HOME!

Mondays at 10PM for 45 minutes, we practice Distance Reiki among all participants that RSVP. Angela and I prepare “space” 15 minutes prior to start time and your participation will involve the following:

1. Sit or Lay comfortably and quietly.

2. *Set your intent to heal yourself and others participating to receive
whatever is needed for healing to take place.

3. Hold the space for energy to flow, remembering your own
connection to “Oneness” which supports the flow of energy
between the practitioner and recipient.

4. Once your ready and  receptive to receive, set your intent to begin sharing Reiki.

*Participant names will be forwarded via email or text if you prefer. Please use firstname and lastname initial (i.e.Michelle D.) or your Meetup ID Name.when you RSVP. Guest welcome and must RSVP individually; also required to submit (min) $10 donation via PayPal.

There is no “cancellation of energy”. Each individual receives as much Reiki needed at the present time to assist with the unique situations of his/her own life.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at on time  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Sinigual Restaurant
41st and 3rd Ave
(640 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.
results.how_to_find_us: We are the only people there at the time of the event.

results.description:
In this workshop, you will rediscover and experience Central Park in a completely different perspective! 

Thomas, a Primitive Skills instructor, will teach you all aspects of fire while exploring the North Woods of Central Park. This workshop is a great way to disconnect from your busy schedules (and smartphones!) and get reconnect with nature. 

You’ll have the opportunity to:
- Learn what plants are used for friction fires
- Try your hand at making fire by friction with flint and steel, a bow drill, or flower stalk
- Make cordage from plant fibers for your fire by friction kit
-Learn where to find tinder and dry wood and make a proper fire lay up
- Learn how to identify wild edibles and natural healing elements 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/VN1Jv1
results.name: FIRE!! Learn how our ancient ancestors made fire in Central Park!

results.description:
A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus.

Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.

• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps.

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!

• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show

• A great profile pic

So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Send us a profile picture too, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast on Saturday (soundboxonline.com). Also check out Carl J and ADG presents where you can find all of our mixes back. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.

Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G.

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]
results.name: Contribute to our weekly radio show! (12820 plays and counting)

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
Looking to develop speaking and leadership skills? Ace a job interview? Ignite your career? Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Our membership is 280,000 strong. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 13,500 clubs like Bryant Park Toastmasters Club Membership in Manhattan

Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At Bryant Park Toastmasters we provide a safe environment to overcome fear, try new speaking tactics, or practice that upcoming sales presentation. Visit our website

MEETING TIME: Tuesday, 12:10pm to 1:15pm

VISITORS WELCOME: In order for you visit our club you need to register to this meeting and RSVP with your FULL NAME  AT MOST  SUNDA. Please arrive by Noon to allow extra time for security check-in.

** PHOTO ID a must!!

** Bring your confirmation email from a Bryant Park club member having added you to the security list is a must!! 


A Toastmasters Meeting always for follows the same agenda:

• Opening of the meeting by the president and presentation of the guests


• Welcoming by the Toastmaster of the Day and presentation of the watchtowers


• Speeches and Evaluations (up to 4)


• Club Business


• Table Topics Session - Guest can participate if they want to


• General Evaluation


• Closing of the meeting

results.description:
The time has come to WRITE!

For this meetup we may have some small chit chat here and there, but our purpose is singular: to get some writing done. If you have been looking for a time and space to get busy adding words to a current project, then this meetup is for you. I will bring along my bag full of prompts if anyone wants to peruse them to get started, but, for all intents and purposes, this meetup is an opportunity to support you in whatever you need to be working on now.

We have changed the location of the weekly write-ins to the Barnes & Noble cafe.  Since there has been such a low turn out for our write-ins, we figured we should be able to meet in the cafe without causing too much trouble there. They will NOT allow us to reserve a table, and they are very strict about people in the cafe purchasing cafe items, so please be prepared to buy SOMETHING, otherwise the cafe management will ask you (or all of us) to leave! It has been a much more convenient - and productive - spot and for our regulars, so we will stick with it as long as it continues to fit our needs.
results.name: Weekly Write-In!

results.description:
Hi All 

THIS PAGE HAS IMAGES,  if you do not see them and you are viewing this page with

1)  the Meetup App - click the "DESCRIPTION TAB"

2) Android - open your browser's settings menu and click ''REQUEST DESKTOP SITE". 

3) Apple IOS - click the "DESKTOP SITE" button at the bottom of the page.

4) Microsoft Windows - buy a new computer :)

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

I never take myself this seriously 

Just a little more business...

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the group. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE OPEN ARTIST STUDIOS IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now.....

results.description:
From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls.

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension: The Isle of Dread

results.description:
** This game is currently closed to new players.  We have a full house.**

Part I: Servants of the Elder Eye

Following the fall of the Temple of Elemental Evil, peace was restored to the lands of Central Flanaess... for a time. Now, in the wake of the kidnapping of Prince Thrommel of Furyondy, rumors abound of cultists making their way back into the blighted lands surrounding the ruins of The Temple. With these rumors comes a growing sense of paranoia among the people of nearby settlements, and mysterious disappearances and deaths threaten to throw the lands back into chaos.

This 5th Edition D&D game is great for new or experienced players, and will take characters from level 1 to level 4.

The game will be hosted at Barnes & Noble in Edison NJ and will run for 8 sessions plus an introductory/character creation session.  Sessions should run from 6pm until 10pm.


Additional resources: 


Guide to Greyhawk - This pdf gives a brief overview of the campaign world, including new subraces and an expanded list of gods and their domains. 

World of Greyhawk - My website for this classic campaign setting. 


Greyhawk Game - My site for the game, once it starts.

Character Generation Guidelines - This explains some of the basics of character creation for the game.
results.name: The World of Greyhawk - Servants of the Elder Eye

results.description:
Join us for a Real Estate focused evening brought to you by AlleyBoost:

6 – 6:15pm: Enjoy Light Refreshments and hors d’oeuvres

6:15 – 6:45pm: Startup Feedback: 3 startup pitches with feedback from our panel of experts

6:45 – 7:30pm: A panel discussion Moderated by David Mandell on the most important aspects of the commercial real estate process every startup should be educated on. Together the panelists will take you through: • The most important aspects of office space to think through before deciding on the right space for your team.

• A detailed rundown of all costs associated with signing a lease (and how to avoid most of them!)

• A look at non traditional office space solutions that may be a better fit for your business (and how to ensure your broker considers them) • How to expedite your search for office space from months to weeks so you can get back to growing your business7:30 – 8pm: Business Development Networking: Mix and mingle with the audience and panelists

PANEL:

David Mandell, CEO and Co-Founder, PivotDesk 

David Mandell is Co-founder and CEO of PivotDesk, a TechStars Boulder 2012 company that helps find room for growing businesses. As well as being a graduate of the program, David has been a TechStars mentor and has previously served as CEO of Ignighter (currently StepOut) and was a Co-founder and Vice President of Marketing for OneRiot (Previously named Me.dium). David is also the managing partner at VentureVoodoo partners, a consulting firm specializing in brand management for startup organizations. Prior to his career and work with startups, David worked at Deloitte - where he was the first marketing hire. He helped lead and manage the global brand launch and communications strategy following Deloitte Consulting’s separation from Deloitte & Touche. The comparative strategy succeeded in distinguishing the brand from its competitors and facilitated the company’s rise to one of the top-three brands in the industry. David also served as EVP, GM for Cohn & Wolfe, a NY-based marketing and communications agency.


Jonathan Wasserstrum, CEO and Co-Founder, TheSquareFoot

Jonathan graduated from Columbia Business School in May 2012. Prior to business school, Jonathan worked in the International Capital Group at Jones Lang LaSalle where he advised foreign and domestic clients on more than $3 billion worth of transactions globally. Jonathan has a BA in Economics from Emory University. He’s interested in the three B’s -- bourbon, buffalo wings, and brass bands.


Arie Barendrecht, CEO and Co-Founder, WiredScore

Arie Barendrecht is the Co-Founder of WiredScore and Director of the Wired Certification program, the first certification platform for internet connectivity in office buildings. Wired Certification launched in September 2013 as “WiredNYC”, in partnership with the New York City Economic Development Corporation and former Mayor Michael Bloomberg. The objective of the WiredScore platform is to promote transparency around the connectivity of office buildings, which involves helping tenants & brokers locate tech-friendly office space and landlords to better understand, benchmark, and market the telecommunications capabilities of their buildings. Prior to founding WiredScore, Arie spent the last few years as a consultant with the Boston Consulting Group in New York City focused on tech & media and as a student pursuing an MBA at the Wharton School, where he graduated in 2010.


Michael Mandel, CEO and Co-Founder, Compstak

Michael is Co-Founder + CEO of CompStak. CompStak creates transparency in commercial real estate by gathering information that is hard to find, difficult to compile or otherwise unavailable. The world’s largest brokerage firms and most preeminent real estate investors use CompStak’s commercial real estate data to compare properties and make investment decisions. Since launching CompStak in early 2012, Michael has helped navigate the company through tremendous growth, with over $10 million raised, 17 major markets launched, and a 55 person team. He has been named 30 Under 30 by Real Estate New York, and a Rising Star by The Real Deal.

Thank you to our sponsor!

Businesses are dynamic. Commercial Real estate is not. PivotDesk is an office-sharing marketplace that matches offices with excess space to companies that need it. Flexible agreements eliminate the risk of a long-term lease, allowing entrepreneurs to offset costs so they can focus on what's most important—growing their business.
results.name: Startup Chat w/ CEO of PivotDesk, TheSquareFoot, Compstak and WiredScore
