results.description:
Do you ever find yourself in the situation where the conversation is going so well, then your prospect hits you with a big objection?  Do you freeze, stammer, make stuff up?  A lot of times we find it hard to navigate perfectly valid questions that inevitably come up in the course of a sale.


In this session, two stellar sales leaders to share some of the ways they have found to setup yourself up for success and overcome objections with winning strategies and tactics that move your deals forward.  On our panel are:


• Josh Appelbaum, Associate Director of Sales Development at Argyle Executive Forum

• Joel Rodriguez, Senior Director of Sales at Persado


We look forward to seeing you in March and please share this event with your friends and colleagues in sales.  You can also http://entsale.co/sdrmeet09">post on LinkedIn and share over Twitter.

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Josh Appelbaum is a Sales Development & Inside Sales leader with a focus on building and growing high-performance sales cultures.  As the Associate Director of Sales Development @ Argyle Executive Forum, Josh leads a team of 6 SDRs tasked with generating demand for Argyle’s premium event sponsorship packages.  Josh was one of Argyle’s early sales hires and was instrumental in structuring the inside sales org after the ‘Predictable Revenue’ model, similar to many high-growth SaaS companies. Most recently, Josh’s team delivered 40% YoY organic revenue growth and have helped land clients like HP, Microsoft, and Fitbit. Prior to managing Argyle’s SDR team, Josh was an SDR Team Lead – a role which included both management and individual contributor responsibilities.   Before building out Argyle’s SDR team, Josh became the company’s first SDR after working on the Data & Analytics team supporting Argyle’s revenue org. Previously, Josh’s sales career began in residential real estate. Josh earned his bachelor’s degree in Psychology from The University of Vermont and lives in Brooklyn.

Joel Rodriguez

is a sales leader and entrepreneur with experience building effective teams and a track record of delivering new business and month-over-month sales growth. Joel is currently Senior Director of Sales at Persado, an NYC-based marketing technology startup. Before Persado, Joel was Head of Sales at SumAll, an NYC-based marketing analytics company, where he started and built an inside sales team of 5 that booked the company's first $1M in ARR. Before SumAll, he was cofounder & CEO of Acquaintable, a venture-backed startup in the online dating space that enables people to meet friends-of-friends. Acquaintable was acquired by Reveal (formerly LikeBright) in November 2013. Previously, Joel was an Associate at Commonwealth Capital Ventures, where he participated in all aspects of the investment cycle and worked on projects with portfolio company CEOs. Prior to joining Commonwealth, he was a Senior Associate Consultant in the New York office of Bain & Company, a global management consulting firm. Joel graduated Cum Laude from Duke University in 2006 with a B.S. in economics. 


***

THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS THIS MONTH

Hired simply kicks ass if you are searching for your next great sales gig with the next hot startup. Create your personal profile here and land your dream job!

Also thanks to Smartling for providing us their great venue for our events.
results.name: Tackling Objections w/ Argyle Executive Forum & Persado

results.description:
This group offers support for men and women who are 50+ and thinking of separating and divorcing or are already in the midst of a divorce or are dealing with post-divorce.  Every phase of life brings different issues and questions and all people do not fit into a one-size-fits-all mold.


If you are considering (or are in the midst of) a divorce after the age of 50, your concerns are different, as are your potential risks and possible mistakes and so here's a group created just for you.   Life has given us a different perspective than when we were younger and you know that no one can be an expert on every topic but you learn to get the information needed when it is required.  This group is here to make that information-gathering process easier and it will also be a comfortable place get all your legal questions answered and meet some other people going through a similar situation at the same time as you.

Some of the issues that will be discussed that may be unique to our phase of life are pensions, retirements, maintenance, social security, the adult children, maybe there are grandchildren and the house.  We hope you will join the next group meeting.

This group is combined with the Separation and Divorce Legal Group to increase the likelihood of group support and we also try to promote it via calendar of events in the community. As this group grows, we will separate the groups -- this way works best for now.

Bring your questions for an even livelier discussion. We look forward to seeing you then.

If this date is not good for you, this group meets on the first Thursday of every  month. We also offer a free consultation appointment in our office at a time that is convenient for you -- you can make that appointment whether you attend this group meeting or not.

You can also visit www.lawjaw.com for more info about our law firm.

Meeting is from 6:00pm to 7:30pm.  Please call the office at[masked] if you cannot arrive by 6:30pm.
results.how_to_find_us: Just west of Community Drive on Northern Blvd.  Parking in rear of building.

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Welcome to our FinTech Open Mic Night series in New York. Please join us for our monthly mixture of presentations, skype-ins, fireside chats and shout-outs plus plenty of networking.

This monthly session is designed to provide an opportunity to catch up with your peers, to see what's going on in the New York and International FinTech scenes and to tell us all about yourself and your own work.

This month's topic is Bloomberg Disruptors, new companies delivering complete market information platforms at a fraction of the price of a Bloomberg terminal. Please join us to see a range of companies pitch their platforms followed by a panel session discussion with the audience.


Here's an interesting article from The New York Times on the subject: The Bloomberg Terminal, a Wall Street Fixture, Faces Upstarts


                                                  Agenda

Please be aware that the agenda is updated on a regular basis

6:00pm - Doors open

Refreshments and networking opportunities

7:00pm - Session starts

-> Welcome address 

Ashish Singal, NewFinance New York Chapter Organiser


-> Sponsor messages

The Barclays Accelerator by Techstars
Rise New York
OTS Solutions
UK Trade & Investment


-> An Introduction to Bloomberg

Ashish Singal, NewFinance New York Chapter Organiser

Why Bloomberg has such a solid grip on the institutional financial information industry, and an overview of the various FinTech companies grabbing at pieces of the pie

-> Presentations

Mihir Dange, Co-Founder of Metricle, Inc. a financial event detection company that locates breaking news source events within seconds


Rishi Singh, Founder of Tiingo.com - Making high-end financial tools accessible to everyone


Andy Bodrog, Director of Sales at Money.Net, a platform that empowers you to analyze and monitor markets in real-time


-> Panel Session

An open discussion with both speakers and delegates exploring the presentations so far and the future of Bloomberg Disruptors

In addition to our speakers we'll be joined by:

Erik Akre, Director, Global Sales at Xignite, leading FinTech innovators to use Xignite financial market data APIs to power their mobile and web apps


Gaurav Saharia, Director of Quantitative Analytics at Money.Net, a platform that empowers you to analyze and monitor markets in real-time

8:30pm - Closing

Shout-outs, communications, feedback and thanks

Further networking opportunities

9:00pm - Session ends

For those of you who would like to continue networking we'll retire to a local bar.

Cheers

Eddie


-------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you to our Partners:

The Barclays Accelerator in partnership with Techstars is helping start-ups take their businesses to the next level and transform the world

OTS Solutions is an Agile Software Development & Technology Product Engineering Company focused on startups and technology entrepreneurs.  With experience of over 13 years, OTS has helped various budding & matured technology businesses in Finance to gain advantage by reducing their burn rates and releasing early to market. Feel free to ask us for help if you struggling with any technology decisions. Contact: Hemant Madaan

Rise New York is a global community of startups and corporates creating the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co-create, and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars.

UK Trade & Investment is the British government’s economic development arm that helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy and supports foreign firms bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy. Our free and confidential services include helping choose a location, provide introductions and give guidance on visas, accommodation, staff relocation and recruitment services. Apply here for our first FinTech Mission to the UK by March 9.

results.description:
Important note: You MUST RSVP here to attend: http://bnichapter.com/visitbni40


Please mention you were invited by Irina Zheleznyak or Seaver Wang


Are referrals an important part of your business? 

BNI (Business Networking International) is an international networking and referral organization with a proven track record of generating business for its members. 

This week we are spotlighting new chapter of Business Networking International forming downtown, near World Trade Center. If you've never attended a BNI meeting before or aren't familiar with the concept this is a great opportunity to learn more. This meeting will be like BNI 101!

FAQs:

How does a regular BNI meeting work?: When you arrive, there will be an opportunity to enjoy 15-30 minutes of open networking. After that our formal meeting begins. Each meeting includes a round of "commercials" from each member and visitor, business coaching, and a special presentation from a chapter member. We have a great leadership team that will guide all first-time guests through the process. 

How will this meeting be different?: Since this is a chapter in the process of forming, the event will not follow the specific structure of a regular meeting. We will still go around the room and have each person introduce themselves and talk about what they do

How many people attend each week?: We expect at least 20 professionals to attend this event

Can I become a member of the chapter?:  Sure! Each chapter only has 1 member per profession. Since this group is just getting started, there are openings in nearly every category- including the most competitive ones

What do I need bring?: We ask guests to bring enough business cards to hand out to the group (25-40)


Is there a fee to attend?: For this meeting there will be NO FEE. The event is at a restaurant/bar so refreshments will be available for purchase if you choose. No drink minimum, no cover charge. 

HOW DO I RSVP?: You MUST RSVP here to attend:  http://bnichapter.com/visitbni40

Please mention you were invited by Irina Zheleznyak or Seaver Wang. RSVP at least 24 hours before the meeting.
results.name: Structured Networking: Special Evening Meeting

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Tuesday March 01,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

This is only to watch the online broadcast part.

Future Day, 1 March, is a global phenomenon. Our goal is to have Future Day adopted as an official holiday by governments on all levels around the world for the global population to consider the future of humanity.

This year, Future Day in Sydney will be celebrated at Deloitte, Level 11, 225 George St, Sydney NSW 2000.

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos3.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2F1%2Fd%2Fc%2Fb%2F600_446707627.jpeg&sig=ADR2i7_58dVj72BI2fhhZD4YbT6zxVCepg

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos1.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2F1%2Fc%2Fe%2F1%2F600_446707393.jpeg&sig=ADR2i780DYtvbXbcUoYol6v8XqW7m80H9g

Schedule:

6:30pm: Arrival, drinks and mingling.

7:00pm: Welcome and Introduction - Peter Xing

7:10pm: The Future of Innovation - Nathan Waters 

7:30pm: The Future of Virtual and Augmented Reality - Scott O'Brien

7:50pm: The Future of Neurotechnology - Peter Simpson-Young

8:10pm: The Future of Artificial Intelligence - Peter Xing

8:30pm: Technology: A Double Edged Sword - Shara Evans

8:50pm: Policies for the Future - Dr James Jansson

9:10pm: Panel discussion and Q&A.

9:30pm-10:00pm: Drinks and mingling.

Speakers:

Nathan Waters - Hackagong

Nathan Waters is an entrepreneur, a consultant, a technologist and an event coordinator always looking to combine new technology and people to make the world more awesome. Founder of Hackagong, GongStartups, and the SydEthereum meetup group. http://hackagong.com/

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos2.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2F1%2Fc%2F5%2F4%2F600_446707252.jpeg&sig=ADR2i7_gnKmjoOEmlv4g-G1uflcfwef45w

Scott O'Brien - Augmented Reality Sydney 

As an Augmented Reality (AR) pioneer since 2009, Scott has seen AR move from "magic show" to functional use cases. In 2015, Scott built AR into a "whites of the eyes", "handshake conversation", an integral and fun part of daily social habit zones (proxemics). It's human nature with greater imagination, happiness, potential, productivity, truth and loyalty. In 2016, Scott is taking AR to the mainstream. http://www.meetup.com/ar_syd/

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos2.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2F1%2Fc%2F5%2F9%2F600_446707257.jpeg&sig=ADR2i780uG093iAPwGg5SVSie9KNxfnXEw

Peter Simpson-Young - Neurotechnologist and Research Officer at MND Australia

Peter Simpson-Young is a graduate in Neuroscience, Psychology and Philosophy from the University of Sydney, and studies Health Technology Innovation at the Charles Perkins Centre, Sydney. Peter has worked and experimented with a range of neurotechnologies, such EEG, Brain-Computer-Interfaces (BCIs), and transcranial electrical stimulation (tES) techniques. Neurotechnologies are having a substantial impact on research and treatments for diseases, and are being developed into consumer devices to help those outside the medical setting. Peter will discuss the recent developments in this area, and the future challenges and opportunities these technologies. https://www.mndaust.asn.au/

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos4.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2Fe%2F5%2F5%2Ff%2F600_447238719.jpeg&sig=ADR2i7-BPOUuTDID85LXnE93uOh1srKy3w

Peter Xing - Transhumanism Australia

Peter Xing is a futurist, transhumanist and AI enthusiast. A Client Manager at Deloitte working with applied think tank, Centre for the Edge, Peter is also a Technology Evangelist and co-founder of Transhumanism Australia. http://www.transhumanism.com.au/

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fphotos1.meetupstatic.com%2Fphotos%2Fevent%2F1%2Fc%2F7%2F7%2F600_446707287.jpeg&sig=ADR2i79KPO_QtXXvEUgPjLl752aSLqplYg

Shara Evans - Market Clarity 

Keynote speaker Shara Evans is internationally acknowledged as a cutting edge technology futurist, commentator, strategy advisor and thought leader, as well as the Founder and CEO of Market Clarity, an award-winning technology analyst firm that provides specialised insight, intelligence and advice on all aspects of the telecom and emerging technologies markets. http://marketclarity.com.au/

Recently, Shara was recognised as one of the world’s top female futurists. http://scienceparty.org.au/

We'll be gathering in the bar-area this time so that we can more easily mix and mingle with each other.  Food and drink are dutch treat.

Hope you'll join us!!

************************************************************

Here is more about this group:

"Inspired" means to "breathe life into".  This group is dedicated to breathing life into YOU, the woman **behind** the business, career, non-profit, or family.  It's a personal-growth, nurture, connection group to fuel the woman first, which then gives her the energy and motivation to serve others.

We are a group of women who have ideas, visions, and a mission to bring to the world. 

We are corporate professionals, business owners, leaders, mothers, non-profit professionals, and entrepreneurs.

We believe in the power of positive thinking, The Secret, What you think about you bring about, The Law of Attraction, and the like.  We're open-minded and accepting of all beliefs as long as they aren't exclusive, negative, or judgmental.  We believe there is more than enough for everyone and have an abundance mentality.

This group is designed to bring like-minded women together so they can support each other's personal growth so they can reach their dreams and goals. 

We will meet monthly and also have some social outings in order to get to know each other better.

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!


Please have a government issued form of ID with you.


This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or to just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.

This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone poses a question, so bring questions!

Some topics up for discussion are:

• Install and configuration assistance

• Documentation, standards, and best practices

• Current events/Conventions

• Release testing and bug reporting

• Getting started with languages like Python and LaTeX

• -Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)

We will also have brief (approx. 5-10 minute) lightning talks, so please speak with a coordinator if you're interested in sharing some of your work.

A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

Bring a project, topic, and questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects. Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves.

results.description:
Do you hate Networking as much as most of us do? Are you also bad at it, often wondering why no one returns your calls or follows up with you after a "Networking Event"? Join us in any of our cities for "The Art of Active Networking", and let's change everything you believe about Networking! 

Take a look at our site and what people say about the events here: TheArtofActiveNetworking.com 

Come see why over 12,000 people have attended worldwide!  Tickets are 20$ on-line on our site until 6pm the day of the event and 30$ at the door until 7:00pm. Each event typically ends about 9:30pm! You must purchase a ticket online in advance to get the 20$ pricing. 

At this event you will make some amazing connections and you will learn why Networking is not about what you get, but what you give and what I call my #GIVE4. You really only need to meet one person to make your entire night worthwhile if you know what you are doing. You will have an opportunity to speak to everyone in the room, and you will absolutely meet people you might otherwise never have an opportunity to meet and you will see that's it's not what you are selling or how you sell it that matters, you will instead learn the importance of building 'know, like and trust' relationships! Finally you are then invited to join all of our groups and pages and use our FREE walls to post up what you might be looking for, all of those links are on our homepage near the ticket link.

Everything you need to know about this event is on our site. Join the pages and the groups, spread the word and also take a look at my TEDxFulton Street talk, also on our site.

TheArtofActiveNetworking.com

I, Mark E. Sackett started this in San Francisco over 7 years ago as a way to help others do better in life, love and business. I own 13 companies and live in San Francisco. I hop between Los Angeles, New York, Vancouver BC and my hometown of Kansas City often. I'm a Director, Producer, Designer, Art Director and Public Speaker. Working daily in Branding, Marketing, Film, Television and Music and as an events producer and speaker allows me to talk about and thrive, while living an authentic, powerful and creative life.

My Mantra: "The power of us all working together is so much greater than anything each of us can accomplish on our own." 

See you soon and I hope your year is about beautiful, powerful connections. Connect with me by clicking below to start sharing my massive networks with those you can help to do better each day!

BE WELL, BE CREATIVE, BE GREAT!

Mark E. Sackett

President/Creative Director/Executive Producer/Director/Public Speaker

Mobile:[masked]|

MarkESackett.com

TheArtofActiveNetworking.com

results.description:
Topic

Needing more performance from your Java applications?
Is latency causing you stress? If so, take a look at Spring's Cache Abstraction!

This code-driven session demonstrates how to integrate Hazelcast Distributed Caches into your Spring (Boot) applications using Spring's Cache Abstraction and Auto Configuration features. JCache, the new standard API for cache access, comes with a full set of annotations that Spring understands since version 4!

Adding a bunch of annotations to a method can achieve an orders-of-magnitude speed improvement in applications with high latency. The meetup gives you an introduction to how to use these standard annotations in your Java / Spring applications when to use which annotations, and what is automagically happening under the covers. You will leave inspired to add 12 characters to your code.

About the Speaker

Viktor Gamov is a Senior Solution Architect at Hazelcast, a leading open-source in-memory data grid(IMDG). Viktor has comprehensive knowledge and expertise in enterprise application architecture leveraging open source technologies. He has helped leading organizations build low latency, scalable and highly available distributed systems. He holds an MS in Computer Science. He is a co-organizer of the: Princeton JUG and New York Hazelcast User Group. He is a co-author of O’Reilly's Enterprise Web Development. Viktor enjoys presenting at various international conferences, blogging and producing a podcast. (http://lanyrd.com/gamussa). He tweets at @gamussa.

Agenda

6:30 pm Registration and Pizza

7-8 pm Presentation
results.name: Caching Made Bootiful: Hazelcast Way

Please join us for an overview of Ansible 2.0 and beyond with Timothy Appnel from Ansible Inc. Tim will explain why the update was necessary, what has changed in Ansible, and what you can expect from Ansible moving forward. You'll also learn about new features available in Ansible 2.0, including:

• Task blocks


• Execution strategies


• Refined playbook parser


• Increased flexibility


• New modules and plugins

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT - PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE.

Gerard Adams, Elite Daily

Gerard Adams, co-founder of Elite Daily, the No.1 news platform for Generation Y, is an experienced angel investor, millennial thought leader and social entrepreneur who overcame early adversity to become a self-made millionaire by the age of 24. Now 30, he has built, backed or invested in nine businesses and trades across multiple industries that have all delivered over seven-figure profits. While he continues his role as an investor and influencer, his mission in life is to mentor and inspire young entrepreneurs on what it takes to be successful and how to turn dreams into reality.

In December 2011, Gerard co-founded and invested in his fastest-growing business idea: Elite Daily. Known as the “Voice of “Generation Y,” the website quickly grew to become the No. 1 platform for news geared toward millennials and was acquired by The Daily Mail in 2015.

Prior to this, Gerard founded various successful companies, including his first online business, a stock forum; Wall Street Grand, an online investor relations and financial marketing company; and National Inflation Association, which helps educate consumers how to survive and prosper in any economy.

Gerard continues to expand and diversify his portfolio and leverage his expertise in millennial branding across industries from digital media to technology to fashion, specifically as a partner for KD Healthcare USA, a medical device company, and by investing into New York City real estate and developments. Passionate about giving back to his community, Gerard helped develop affordable housing for communities in Newark, NJ, where his father and family grew up. He lives in Manhattan with his dog, a dachshund named GiGi.
For more information about Gerard Adams, please visit www.gerardadams.com.

results.description:
This is a four-part workshop, starting on Tuesday 3/1, 3/8, 3/22, 3/29. Your attendance is expected at all classes in order to participate. The class time will be from 6:30-9:30pm each evening.


This March, we will be teaching a four-session iOS development class with Girl Develop It. The class will cover the fundamentals of iOS development - as much as we can cover in four sessions - by guiding you through creating an iOS project of your choice. You can come to class with an idea, or join and work with other attendees on a shared project.

This class is appropriate if you are....

• Interested in making iPhone apps

• (and/or) Interested in learning the fundamentals of iOS software development

• (and/or) A technologist who works with iOS engineers and wants to better collaborate

• (and/or) An engineer who has started learning iOS but wants a structured environment to advance your learning.

This class will cover...

• iOS development & Xcode introduction

• Swift language basics

• iOS interface development and UIKit

• Networking

• Persistence using Core Data


Other take aways..

• Using/integrating external code & libraries


Prerequisites:

In order for you to get a lot out of this class, we'd like you to be familiar with basic programming concepts like objects, variables, collections, functions, and boolean logic.

A Macintosh running OS X El Capitan (10.11) and Xcode 7.2. How to find your installed version of OS X. 

Recommended Knowledge or Areas to Research

• Git/Github (we'll use this to collaborate on our code)

• Object Oriented Programming reviewed in Swift

About the Instructors:

New York-based iOS engineers excited to share our knowledge and network with ‘Girl Develop It’ members.

Julie Yaunches is an iOS engineer at Blue Apron.

Tamar Nachmany is an iOS engineer in Brooklyn, NY. She works at Tumblr.
results.name: Intro to iOS w/ Swift

results.description:
Promoting Veganism in NYC - Union Square Park - SW corner of the park at E. 14th St. & Union Square W.  Look for the "Veg Meetup" sign.

Our meetup group has historically been a social group. (With the subtle activist mission of promoting veganism by showing people how much fun it can be.) While we are, and will continue to be, mostly a social group, we'd like to step up the number of activist events we do.

This March 1st event will be outreach to the general public to promote and encourage a vegan diet & lifestyle. We will hand out literature in a welcoming manner so our audience will be open to seeing how great the benefits of veganism are for people, the non-human animals who share our world, and the planet itself.

We will meet at the designated location in Union Square at 6:30 pm (please arrive on time!). After a brief discussion on strategy and positioning of people, along with a few reminders for the group, we'll leaflet from 6:45 pm to 7:45 pm. Then our group will reassemble at the designated location and walk over to a nearby, all-vegan restaurant to have dinner, discuss our experiences and thoughts, and socialize.

We know that not everyone in our group is vegan, but on this day we will be promoting veganism. You are very welcome to join us even if you are not yet 100% vegan, but please understand that the literature we will hand out will promote a purely vegan lifestyle. Mostly on this day you will be handing out literature rather than talking to people, but if you do happen to speak with people, we are promoting a vegan diet and lifestyle for their tremendous benefits.

Where to meet: We will be meeting at the extreme southwest corner of Union Square Park, where Union Square West meets East 14th Street. We'll meet on the actual park block, right on the corner. You will see us holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign. We will meet right at 6:30pm. You may want to plan on being there early in order to be on time. Don't be late! We will talk for 15 minutes and then disperse to various nearby locations in the park.

We believe that grass-roots activism is vital in advancing the ideal, practice, and potential normalization of veganism in our world. So let's come together and do this, and also have fun while doing it!

Thank You All

Saurabh Dalal and David Greene
results.name: Promoting Veganism in NYC - Union Square Park

</a>The Padmacahaya International Institute for Inner studies is providing free of charge the Usui Reiki Level 1 attunement (via long distance) and the Open Heart Meditation for the public (via written form on the website for printing.)  Anyone with a willing and open heart can do this. You can follow the link above or read about it in our discussion board  The attunement is offered every 1st of the month at 6:30pm your local time and the duration lasts 15 minutes.  Open Heart Meditation can be practiced daily - either once, twice or as much needed throughout the day.  It is suggested to continue with the daily practice of the Open Heart Meditation and Self-Healing once a day for at least 21 days to notice changes.

A professionally created Open Heart Meditation with music in the background can also be purchased online in Itunes  <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/open-heart-meditation/id677392454?i=677392941">https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/open-heart-meditation/id677392454?i=677392941 or CD Baby - http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/irmansyaheffendi2

Full day classes in the United States and in some parts of the World will be posted in the discussion board.

If anyone in the NYC area is interested in classes, please let us know.  There are two paths to choose from - Open Heart Workshops and Reiki TUMMO Workshops.  Both are so beautiful and lead you deeper into the heart to live a more joyful, peaceful life.

With Gratitude,
the NYC/Lower CT group.

If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

We are now going to the next topic in the Heart Sutra, Impermanence and 18 Realms from the perspective of Emptiness/Buddha Dharma.  We had already touched Impermanence during our last workshop, so this time we may also touch on the 12 Links of Conditions Arising.

While the sutra is short, the concepts are deep and that often requires many (and more) sessions to understand.  If you are interested in this type of studies or have some background, this would be a beneficial workshop for you.  It may not be for everyone.

There is no cost to this workshop.  If you want to donate you can donate to your charity of choice or Venerable GuoXing's center.

------------

Venerable Guo Xing will be doing a teaching-workshop where we can discuss and exchange ideas.  We will be learning and discussing the 5 Skandas and Emptiness from the Heart Sutra.


The Heart Sutra (Mahaprajnaparamita-hridaya-sutra) is one of the shortest and best known sutras.  It focuses on the Buddha's teachings in the purest, clearest and most concise essence. http://www.meetup.com/DharmaDrink/pages/The_Heart_Sutra/

Many of you have come to dinner and have met Venerable Guo Xing.  So you know that this will be a rare opportunity to learn from him in this setting.

Venerable Guo Xing is the current Abbot of Chan Meditation Center in Queens NY and Dharma Drum Retreat Center in Upstate NY, part of Dharma Drum Mountain, an international Buddhist organization based in Taiwan. Venerable was ordained under Chan Master Shen Yen in 1986 and assisted the Master between 1987 and 2007 in leading meditation retreats in Taiwan, Southeast Asia, and the United States, totaling more than 50 retreats, including the first 49 day retreat at DDRC in 2000.  Venerable is one of Chan Master Sheng Yen’s Dharma heirs.


_/|\_

Eddie

This week I am going to see Eddie the Eagle I will arrive at 7:00 for the 7:20 pm showing. I  have seat D8 If you are coming post your seat #  If anyone wants to grab a snack at Costco before the movie  leave a comment and I can meet you there at 6:15. I am told you do not have to be a member to go to the snack bar.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it. 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
The Unwanted Houseguest
A Magrevian campaign for 3rd level characters.

The snows have settled heavy in the north of Magrevia, sweeping down from the Buchen Mountains, and blanketing the open hills and treetops with a deadly field of white. The cold eats at the fingers of men tending their animals in barns, and searching for firewood stockpiled against the winter. It came early this year, and Mother help us all.

The hall sits alone in a clearing, trees approach on all sides but a high stone wall holds them back, cutting a walled garden from the wilds. At shuttered windows a glow speaks of warmth and shelter. From one, the sounds of merriment can even be heard, but there is a tension to that laughter, a strain in the cheer… are the participants forcing this celebration to keep the cold at bay, or is it the cold itself doing the forcing?

The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. The Unwanted Houseguest is a storyline for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, for characters of 2-4th level. The focus is on solving mysteries, and the challenge of surviving the horror surrounding you.
results.name: D&D 5E: The Unwanted Houseguest: Session 1

results.description:
I'm very excited to finally schedule Elm's first New York meetup!

Gust is graciously offering their fancy new office space to host this meetup. Stay tuned for updates on food/drink as I put in some lobbying efforts.


The structure of next Tuesday's meeting will be as follows:

1. Introduction -- A chance for me to introduce you all to Gust's office, explore the goals of the meetup and poll you all on what you want to get out of it.

2. Community Projects -- Any member of the community can talk for under 5 minutes about a project they're working on, a library they're building or any undertaking that they might want help with. Whether it's showing off, recruiting team members or soliciting feedback, feel free to use this time to do it! Let me know in advance of Tuesday if you'd like to speak.

3. Hack Elm -- We'll split off into groups and toy around with Elm together. The goal is to collaboratively learn more about Elm while creating something that proves its usefulness. This meeting the theme will be Elm's facilities for "Modeling the Problem" and we'll use Elm to develop illustrations of different data structures. More info to come!

Please feel free to reach out to me with any questions. In addition to email, I'm available in the elmlang slack channel as @noahzgordon.

Looking forward to seeing you all there!

-Noah
results.name: Elm NYC's First Meetup!

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.

results.description:
This meetup is held the first Tuesday of each month and has two purposes.

First, it serves as a general networking opportunity for Permies in the area to meet each other and to provide mutual aid. What are you working on and where? What kind of collaborators and skills sets do you want to add to your team? Do you have an idea that you'd like to share just for feedback and exploration?

Second, this is an information session to increase knowledge about the numerous ways that permaculture can be applied in the world, from gardening/farming practices and land stewardship, to regenerative economic systems, community building, and nature connection.

*A $5 donation will be optional for our meetups. Proceeds help sponsor PDC students and other sustainable culture educational projects in the Northeast. The PayPal link sends a donation to Green Phoenix Permaculture, a 501c3 organization.*
results.name: Monthly Meetup (Meet & Greet; Project Share)

We'll be taking over the space at 7:00 sharp, and the evening should be in full swing by 7:10!  (Latecomers are still welcome, of course.)

Writers, if you're bringing something to present, don't forget to bring ample COMPLETE and IDENTICAL copies of the scene(s) --- one copy for each actor you'll need, plus one copy for a reader of any stage directions.  (And if you're able to provide character descriptions in the form of a breakdown appended as page 1 --- that's never a bad idea. :))

Actors, come ready to read!

There is so much good news I don't know where to begin!  For starters we are doing our monthly film shoots so bring in a scene if you like or come in and see if some of the writers can use you in their work!  So far Jan was shot and is in edit and Feb has been scripted and is being scheduled.  March is semi booked but April seems open!   

Also since everyone has shown interest we will be doing an Actors Showcase in the next month or so.  We will send out details but basically it will be in the larger room and with plenty of seating for an audience so we can bring agents/family/friends or whoever to watch our work.  Maybe an audience award with a prize like a photo shoot or something.  We are open to suggestions.

results.description:
https://www.facebook.com/events/181022785601260/

The Age of Insight: The Quest to Understand the Unconscious in Art, Mind, and Brain, from Vienna 1900 to the Present by Eric Kandel

A brilliant book by Nobel Prize winner Eric R. Kandel, The Age of Insight takes us to Vienna 1900, where leaders in science, medicine, and art began a revolution that changed forever how we think about the human mind—our conscious and unconscious thoughts and emotions—and how mind and brain relate to art.

The Vienna School of Medicine led the way with its realization that truth lies hidden beneath the surface. That principle infused Viennese culture and strongly influenced the other pioneers of Vienna 1900. Sigmund Freud shocked the world with his insights into how our everyday unconscious aggressive and erotic desires are repressed and disguised in symbols, dreams, and behavior. Arthur Schnitzler revealed women’s unconscious sexuality in his novels through his innovative use of the interior monologue. Gustav Klimt, Oscar Kokoschka, and Egon Schiele created startlingly evocative and honest portraits that expressed unconscious lust, desire, anxiety, and the fear of death.

Kandel tells the story of how these pioneers—Freud, Schnitzler, Klimt, Kokoschka, and Schiele—inspired by the Vienna School of Medicine, in turn influenced the founders of the Vienna School of Art History to ask pivotal questions such as What does the viewer bring to a work of art? How does the beholder respond to it? These questions prompted new and ongoing discoveries in psychology and brain biology, leading to revelations about how we see and perceive, how we think and feel, and how we respond to and create works of art. Kandel, one of the leading scientific thinkers of our time, places these five innovators in the context of today’s cutting-edge science and gives us a new understanding of the modernist art of Klimt, Kokoschka, and Schiele, as well as the school of thought of Freud and Schnitzler. Reinvigorating the intellectual enquiry that began in Vienna 1900, 

The Age of Insight is a wonderfully written, superbly researched, and beautifully illustrated book that also provides a foundation for future work in neuroscience and the humanities. It is an extraordinary book from an international leader in neuroscience and intellectual history.

This event is hosted by Bob Braine. for information on this month's book, email [masked]. This event is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.
results.name: CFI-LI Book Club: The Age of Insight by Eric Kandel

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Olga Ast, an interdisciplinary artist, presents her exploration of the changing visualizations of Time to the Mythological Roundtable of New York.

From the ancient world, to the symbols of time we use today, Olga traces its depiction and its influences of human understanding in art, science, philosophy and technology. The visual metaphors of Time reveal how we ourselves have evolved in relation to time.

Short Bio

Olga Ast has exhibited and lectured internationally, presenting her work at Rutgers, New York, Goettingen, Moscow & Michigan Universities, the MIT, the DC Art Science Rendezvous (DASER) at National Academy of Sciences, the Leonardo Art Forum (LASER), the Museum of Natural Sciences of Turin, the Kloone 4000 International Art/Science Project, the Philoctetes Center for the Multidisciplinary Study at the New York Psychoanalytic Institute, the New Media Caucus and NYC Future Salon. Ast published several books, including Fleeing from Absence: four cross-disciplinary essays on time, its nature and its interpretations; and Infinite Instances: Studies & Images of Time, a collection of papers and artworks by contributors to the ArcheTime project, dedicated to exploring artistic, academic, and scientific concepts of time, which Ast has been curating since 2009.
results.name: Mythology of Time

results.description:
Dear Enneagram Group,

We will move to a new topic in March, one intended to be fully interactive, and to relate to some ideas discussed at our last meeting.

The plan is to experiment with a few party gram-type activities - interspersed with discussion on how various styles and moments of spontaneous play may be seen through an Enneagram lens.  The purpose is to have the whole group provide feedback on whatever comes up.  (Not necessarily as a final arbiter of what various person's correct types may be - but as an attempt to make as clear as possible our collective focus on how the Enneagram applies, moment to moment, allowing for different perspectives as need be.)

We'll sample from among a few games, likely including:

"Real People" - a face-reading game concerning questions about strangers' answers to various questions, just from viewing their faces.  This game is not so much about noticing our own types at work as about rapidly sizing up other peoples' personality patterns - to the extent these are actually readable in the face.  It may serve as an interesting warm-up.

"Cranium" - a multi-faceted game based on a variety of activities involving different types of mini-challenges (knowledge puzzles, word puzzles, physical and mental "charades" type activities).  The premise is that one is to exercise "all parts of one's cranium" - which could lead to interesting patterns as regards relative skill levels, as related to patterns of overall personality.

"Dixit" - a creative symbolization / story-telling game involving formulating and guessing about clues, concerning examples from a set of suggestive pictures.  This game could possibly lead to deeper insights than the others are likely to, though it's intended for small group of three to six, so we might have to split into two groups to play, depending on attendance. Newcomers to the group are welcome, but are asked to contact the Organizer (click on name at left) ahead of time.  This is to assure that we have a reasonable mix of experienced and new people in the room - to keep our dialog moving forward.  If you're interested in attending but haven't been to our group before, please email Organizer a few days ahead (say, by 2/25/16), and we can arrange a conversation.

Hope you choose to attend.

Regards, Nicholas (Organizer)

results.description:
Gene Murrow will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by the Gotham Gals!

The first Playford Ball prep session will also be featured in the dance selection tonight.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.

results.description:
Prolog, the general-purpose deductive logic-programming language has been condemned to relative obscurity in the din of new programming languages and paradigms. 

Yet, it remains alive and vital. Prolog is more intuitive, elegant than most special purpose query languages. It lets us express deductive queries more compactly and understandably (to rule out ultra-compact one-letter languages :) than any other query language. 

Lispers (of all flavors) have observed this. They have awesome implementations of prolog-like features that can be embedded into their native programming systems [1,2]. 

I wanted to bring the same joy to the world of typed programming languages. I want to walk the community through the act of embedding Prolog as a query language into OCaml Systems. In this talk I present a starter kit towards implementing a Prolog in OCaml. 

The main takeaways from my talk will be: Fashioning the internals of a query engine in OCaml. I will focus on unification and backtracking. Fashioning a query parser in OCaml in menhir tying the two together.

I intend to keep this talk very introductory and accessible to anyone with some familiarity with functional programming languages. Towards this goal, I will choose to focus on a very tiny subset of Prolog for my talk. 

References. 
[1] http://minikanren.org/
[2] <a>https://github.com/swannodette/logic-tutorial­</a>;
results.name: Crafting your own Prolog using OCaml by Prasad Rao

Amazing Christian and Jewish believers like you will gather to receive in-depth biblical and theological training. March's Smutty Book Club book is The Angel (The Original Sinners) Tiffany Reisz<a href="http://www.amazon.com/Tiffany-Reisz/e/B004FSQI6S/ref=dp_byline_cont_book_1"></a>.  Recommended by Helen, this is a very hot S&M book. It involves a priest who sends this woman off to train this boy to be a submissive. There is a lot of sex starting with page ten. So it's pretty much blasphemy and debauchery just in time for Easter.  

What  the Publisher says: 

No safe word can protect the heart

Infamous erotica author and accomplished dominatrix Nora Sutherlin is doing something utterly out of character: hiding. While her longtime lover, Søren—whose fetishes, if exposed, would be his ruin—is under scrutiny pending a major promotion, Nora's lying low and away from temptation in the lap of luxury.

Her host, the wealthy and uninhibited Griffin Fiske, is thrilled to have Nora stay at his country estate, especially once he meets her traveling companion. Young, inexperienced and angelically beautiful, Michael has become Nora's protégé, and this summer with Griffin is going to be his training, where the hazing never ends.

But while her flesh is willing, Nora's mind is wandering. To thoughts of Søren, her master, under investigation by a journalist with an ax to grind. And to another man from Nora's past, whose hold on her is less bruising, but whose secrets are no less painful. It's a summer that will prove the old adage: love hurts.

So This is where we usually include one good review and one bad review from Goodreads.  But I honestly couldn't find a bad review. Just a lot of "OMG Love This Book" and a lot of pictures of that Scarsgard dude from True Blood.  So enjoy I guess.

See you in March at Smutty Book Club!

Dawn

This group meets on the first Tuesday of each month to view SF and other genre related films. Dining follows the movie.

Hey look!  A Dungeons and Dragon ride!


With these fateful words six friends visiting an amusement park one Sunday climb aboard a themed roller-coaster ride and are magically transported into the Realm of Dungeons & Dragons. Here they are mentored by a gnomish wizard named the Dungeon Master who assigns them roles along with magical totems.

Befriending a baby unicorn they nickname Uni the kids are soon caught in a skirmish between a five-headed dragon known as Tiamat and the fiendish Venger who wants their totems to subjugate the many-headed dragon queen before he can conquer the Realm.

Stranded in this fantastic world these new heroes must follow the Dungeon Master's cryptic advice as he guides them homewards on adventures exploring the strange Realm, battling monsters, opposing tyrants and outwitting Venger.

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place: Degustation presents a provocative menu of Iberian, French and American influenced cuisine in a dynamic yet intimate bar setting, with an open kitchen. The local market inspired menu pairs beautifully with the hand selected wine offering.

We will be participating in the seven course Chef's Tasting Menu that is $85pp.


http://degustation-nyc.com/

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Since last year, the XPRIZE Think Tank has hosted in-depth discussions around exponential technologies and global challenges. We’ve personally watched the group grow in passion and excitement, which makes this announcement that much more fulfilling.


Every month starting from March, the Think Tank will propose a moonshot challenge for all interested members and participants to solve. Each month will kick off a 4-week incubation period that will nurture any and all ideas that tackle the monthly challenge into viable product plans. You'll be provided with valuable resources, network, and guidance on every step of the way, so you will never feel like you are solving this alone.


This month of March, we’re going to be investigating the topic of Urban Farming. Along with Think Tank leaders and a local entrepreneur making waves in NYC urban farming, you’ll be able to learn about this area of emerging technology as well as creating a solution that could revolutionize it.


The challenge that we’re proposing is the following:

Create a solution that makes vegetative urban farming fun, accessible, and financially feasible for the average NYC resident, while supporting the city’s impoverished and promoting environmental sustainability.


There are 5 parts to this challenge explained:

Fun: Right now urban farming is considered a ‘nice to have’ niche. But as you will learn at this event, the idea of growing one’s produce can involve something very different than the perceived inconvenience of managing your own produce.

Accessible: Your solution should be easily accessible by the average NYC resident. No expensive equipment or complex assembly/maintenance please! 

Financially feasible: The only way that urban farming can gain traction in a city like NYC is through business incentives. Commercial models and cost saving measures will offer us the first two major areas of improvement when it comes to grocery shopping and food access.

Supporting the impoverished: Urban farming can provide a potentially limitless source of food for a city setting. We believe that those who currently lack access to fresh, nutritious produce will greatly benefit from this abundance.

Promoting environmental sustainability:  By growing food in our own urban backyard, we can significantly reduce carbon emission due to external food transportation and more efficient means of production.


So, if you want to learn more about urban farming, create an innovative and effective solution to this challenge from scratch, and make impact in NYC (and the greater world of course), definitely show up this Tuesday!! We'll have brainstorming session and assemble teams based on the qualities of the idea from the brainstorms. At the end of March, there will be a Think Tank Pitchfest, where all participating teams pitch their hashed-out idea/product plan to the audience and a panel of judges, which may include potential investors and industry experts.  We’ll provide more details over the coming weeks.


Let's make it happen. See you soon!


The Think Tank Team

P.S. For a nice, motivational video from the XPRIZE parent:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SsZev7S4Rzs

The Bible Scholar Series is an exciting one-semester Bible college class that is taught on Wall Street in Manhattan. Amazing Christian and Jewish believers like you will gather to receive in-depth biblical and theological training. Those who complete this course will be equipped to actively fulfill the personal life calling that God has placed on their lives. This will truly be a life-changing course! Interfaith and irreligious learners are also warmly invited to enroll in this program, and they will find the curriculum enjoyable and informative.

This program will consist of a two-hour class that meets each week, with a total of 6 classes during the semester (for a total of 12 hours of class time).

• Dates of Semester: Every Tuesday Starting February 23 through March 29 (6 classes)


• Latecomers:  Everyone is welcome to join the class late as each week will be covering a new and valuable topic


• Day & Time: Tuesday Evenings, 7:00-9:00pm • Location: 48 Wall Street, Manhattan (5th Floor)


• Class Cost: FREE


• Accreditation: The Bible Scholar Series is Currently Unaccredited


• More information @ http://www.hopehill.com/events/bible-scholar-series

IMPORTANT: Due to Wall Street security, doors will lock 15 minutes after start time, so be sure to be on time. If you come late, please text[masked] or[masked] and we will send someone from the meeting to let you in.

#HopeHillNYC
results.name: Free 6-Week Seminary

results.description:
The New York Review of Science Fiction Readings
presents
Karen Heuler
Chandler Klang Smith

Tuesday, March 1st -- doors open 6:30 p.m.
$7 suggested donation
The Commons | 388 Atlantic Avenue
(directions & links below) Dunno whether March will start as a lion or lamb, but we can tell you that these two writers will have you roaring and bleating for more.

---
Chandler Klang Smith is a graduate of Bennington College and the creative writing MFA program at Columbia University. Her first novel, Goldenland Past Dark, was published by ChiZine Publications in 2013, and her second novel, The Sky Is Yours, is forthcoming from Hogarth (an imprint of the Crown Publishing Group at Random House) in 2017.

Karen Heuler’s stories have appeared in over 90 literary and speculative magazines and anthologies, from Alaska Quarterly Review to Clarkesworld to Weird Tales, as well as a number of Best Of anthologies. She has published four novels and two story collections with university and small presses, and her last collection was chosen for Publishers Weekly’s Best Books of 2013 list. She has received an O. Henry award, been shortlisted for a Pushcart Prize, for the Iowa short fiction award, the Bellwether award and the Shirley Jackson award for short fiction. Later this year, Aqueduct Press will be publishing her next collection, which follows women facing strange circumstances on this world and others.

---
As always, the Cafe will see to your wining, dining and other worldly needs; and the Jenna freebie table will offer books and goodies, as will the raffle for any who donate.

After the event, please join us as we treat our readers for dinner and drinks at the cafe.

Jim Freund is Producer and Executive Curator of The New York Review of Science Fiction Readings. He has been involved in producing radio programs of and about literary sf/f since 1967. His long-running live radio program, “Hour of the Wolf,” broadcasts and streams every Wednesday night/Thursday morning from 1:30-3:00 AM. Programs are available by stream for a few months after broadcast. (Check http://hourwolf.com, or join the Hour of the Wolf group on Facebook for details.) In addition, Jim is Podcast Host and Post-Production Editor for the twice-consecutive Hugo Award-winning Lightspeed Magazine.

The Brooklyn Commons Cafe at 388 Atlantic Avenue is an open and collaborative movement building space, only minutes away from the Hoyt-Schermerhorn and Atlantic Avenue subway stops in downtown Brooklyn. The Commons provides resources to the progressive community including affordable office and meeting spaces as well as an event venue that can host anything from parties and benefits to forums, performances, films and workshops. If you are interested in meeting or event space, please contact them at [masked].

After the event, please join us as we treat our readers for dinner and drinks at the cafe. More complete (and graphically pleasing) info at http://hourwolf.com/nyrsf/NYRSFr_160301-Heuler-Smith/

---
WHEN:
Tuesday, March 1st
Doors open at 6:30 -- event begins at 7

WHERE:
The Brooklyn Commons
388 Atlantic Avenue (between Hoyt & Bond St.)
Hoyt-Schermerhorn subway stop (A,C,G); Nevins St. (2,3,4,5); and the Barclay Center (B,D,N,R,Q,2,3,4,5, and LIRR).
https://www.google.com/maps/place/388+Atlantic+Ave,+Brooklyn,+NY+11217

Coming up:
April 5: Clockwork Phoenix 5 launch reading with Mike Allen and a cast of thousands!
May 3: Andrea Hairston & Pan Morigan musical drama project
June 7: Space & Time Magazine's 50th anniversary gala

The New York Review of Science Fiction magazine is celebrating its 25th year!
Subscribe or submit articles to the magazine!

New York Review of Science Fiction
PO. Box 78, Pleasantville, NY, 10570
NYRSF Magazine: http://nyrsf.com/

---

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Chartbeat


Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.
