results.description:
Hello everyone, 

We are grateful to Eric, Christopher, Brian, and all others who have maintained this group throughout the years. I'm helping ACIM teacher, Jeffrey Mironov facilitate this new version of the group. I've put all the details on the meetup website, but if you have any questions, feel free to get in touch. 

If you'd like to get a feel for Jeff's teaching of the Course, please check out these short clips from his youtube site. I hope you'll find them as inspiring and entertaining as I do and you'll consider sharing your presence with us!

There won't be a lot of rules to follow and there's no charge for attendance. We only ask that you show up on time with an open mind, and feel free to share any questions/ideas you may have as the evening progresses. 


We'd like to concentrate each session with a topic from the Course. If you can bring the book, that would be helpful. This week, we'll read and discuss the intro to Chapter 11 - "God or the Ego." 


The remembrance of Who we are as God created us, is the only True point of this meetup. For me personally, it has been some of the deepest and most profound conversations I've had. I hope you'll join us on Tuesday at 7pm for a new look at the Course - it promises to be an enlightening session!

Sincerely,

Kevin
results.how_to_find_us: Jeff's apartment is close to the 1 train stop on 86st, near Riverside drive on the north side of 87th st. The door of 15f will be unlocked, so just enter. Please remove your shoes before entering. See you soon!
results.name: ACIM in NYC - new meetup!

group.name: The New York City A Course In Miracles Meetup Group

results.description:
Because of the overwhelming interest in this Meetup, I called and asked about the back room. I was told there is no back room which made me question my sanity because the guy yesterday said there was a back room... Anyway, I asked whether it was possible to reserve room for more than 10 people.

The answer is that yes, he can reserve space for more of us BUT they charge a two drink minimum which is approximately $20 a person.  I was told this requirement applies even for 10 people.

So, I need to know if the folks who are already on the list are okay with that and if people on the waiting list are okay with it. If so, I will open up the RSVP to more people.

If no one is up for it, I will cancel the reservation and will hunt down another space and if it doesn't work for the 1st, we'll do it another day.

For whoever asked, DTUT stands for "Downtown Uptown."

Thanks.

Please join us at our March General Meeting of the Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots-  Tuesday, March 1st, at 7:00 PM.

This Month's guest speaker is Christopher McGrath, Republican candidate in the April 19th Special Election for convicted criminal Dean Skelos's  NY State Senate seat. Mr. McGrath will speak for approximately 20 minutes and then respond to any questions from the floor. Bring your friends and neighbors.

In addition,  new member James Stagno, will speak to us and share his thoughts and ideas on how to address some of the problems for the homeless in NY.

**************************************************************************

Also, "Bob Dann's Tea Party University", and his specially  hand picked "Video(s) of the Month".


***************************************************************************

Don't forget to purchase your 50/50 raffle tickets at all of our meetings. Last month's winner walked away with  $150.00! Get a full arm's length of tickets for only $10.00. You can use your arm, our arm, or the really tall guy with the long arms sitting next to you!!

Remember, we use the proceeds of our monthly raffle sales to help offset the costs of running our meetings. Please participate, and be generous!

*****************************************************************

Please Note:

Speakers and agenda times listed above are subject to change. With only a few exceptions our General Meetings are held the first Tuesday of every month from 7:00 to 9:00 PM at the American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. All of our meetings are open to the public. Doors open around 6:30 for early-birds, shmoozers, and those wishing to help us set up the meeting. Our actual meeting begins at 7 PM.

All are welcome. Bring your neighbors, bring your friends!

We respectfully request that you RSVP your attendance to all of our meetings and events regardless of if you are able to attend or not. Simply click the link contained inside this invitation to RSVP.  Please do it now. Thank You.

results.description:
The Annual Banff Mountain Film Festival World Tour is returning for our 18th year in NYC for four nights at the Peter Norton Symphony Space, 2537 Broadway at 95th, 7:30 pm, Sunday, February 28th and Monday, February 29th; Tuesday, March 1st and Wednesday, March 2nd, 2016. Doors open at 7:00 pm. Arrive early and hear alphornist Barbara Oldham at 7:15. Note: The film menu will be the same on Sunday and Tuesday; a completely different film menu will be shown on Monday and Wednesday (see film menus below). Tickets are $24 in advance and $27 at the door on the day of the show. Group sales of fifteen or more tickets purchased in advance are $21 (only at Symphony Space). Tickets are available now at Symphony Space and at our retail partner, Paragon Sports. Symphony Space Box office: 2537 Broadway at 95th, 212.864.5400.
Tickets are available for purchase at the Box Office or by phone Tues. through Sun., 1pm - 6pm; or online at <a>www.symphonyspace.org.</a> Note: on each day of the show, the Box Office will be open until 7:45 pm to sell tickets, if any are still available). Paragon Sports, 867 Broadway at 18th,[masked], ext 2.
Tickets are available for purchase at the Specialty Counter on the 2nd floor or by phone: Mon. through Fri. 10am - 8:30pm; Sat. 10am - 8pm; and Sun. 11am -7pm. Note: Tickets will not be available at Paragon Sports the day of the show. Day of show tickets (if available - usually not), must be purchased at Symphony Space. 

 To see the awesome 2016 Banff Intro video go to:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bHnqUQ1c6yc&feature=youtu.be

NEW YORK CITY
Film Menu
Sunday, February 28th and Tuesday, March 1, 2016 The Important Places
Best Short Mountain Film
(2015, USA, 9 min)
Filmmakers: Gnarly Bay, Forest Woodward
www.gnarlybay.com
Parental Guidance: coarse language Using a mix of old 16mm footage and new visuals, a son rediscovers the necessity of returning to and protecting “the important places” in our lives. The Last Dragons
(2014, USA, 10 min)
Filmmakers: Jeremy Monroe, David Herasimtschuk
www.freshwatersillustrated.org
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory An intimate glimpse at North America's Eastern Hellbender, an ancient salamander as mythical as it is real. And in many waters, myths are all that remain of these sentinel stream-dwellers. Darklight (special edit)
(2015, USA, 5 min)
Filmmaker: Rachel Franks, Matt O’Connor, ZacRamras, Mike Brown
www.sweetgrass-productions.com
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory In 2014, the award winning film Afterglow followed skiers down impossibly lit, virgin powder slopes in the dead of night. Get ready for the sequel, this time on two wheels. Unbranded (special edit)
People’s Choice Award
(2015, USA, 46 min)
Filmmakers: Dennis Aig, Phillip Baribeau
www.unbrandedthefilm.com
Parental Guidance: coarse language Four men and 16 wild mustangs set off on a 5000 kilometre journey across the American West from Mexico to Canada. In the spirit of true adventure, whiskey is drunk, tempers fly, tragedy strikes, and the bonds of friendship hold fast. But can the journey help save the plight of the wild horses roaming on public lands? Only time will tell. Nature Rx
(2015, USA, 1 min)
Filmmakers: Justin Bogardus
www.nature-rx.org
Parental Guidance: no advisory Is life a little too mundane or overwhelming? Feeling tired, irritable or stressed out? Maybe Nature Rx is just the ticket. Kroger’s Canteen
(2015, South Africa, 8 min)
Filmmakers: Greg Fell, Dean Leslie
www.theafricanattachment.com
Parental Guidance: General; coarse language In 2014, Kilian Jornet won the Hardrock 100 mile race through the San Juan’s of Colorado. Along the way he stopped at Kroger’s Canteen – an aid station perched on a tiny ledge, 13,100ft above sea level. This is a story about that aid station, about the people who make it happen, and about the spirit one can only find at the Hardrock 100. Denali
(2015, USA, 8 min)
Filmmakers: Ben Moon, Ben Knight
www.benmoon.com
Parental Guidance: no advisory There's no easy way to say goodbye to a friend, especially when they've supported you through your darkest times. Women’s Speed Ascent
(2015, USA, 4 min)
Filmmakers: Keith Ladzinski, Chris Alstrin
www.3stringspro.com
Parental Guidance: Coarse language Mayan Smith-Gobat and Libby Sauter knew that the women's speed record for the ascent of The Nose on El Cap was theirs for the taking. Crushing the old record after just a few days of attempts, Mayan and Libby put their names in the record book of the infamous route in the Yosemite National Park. Paddle for the North (special edit)
(2015, New Zealand, 27 min)
Filmmaker: Alexander Behse, Simon Lucas
www.paddleforthenorth.org
Parental Guidance: coarse language On an adventure of a lifetime, six young guys paddle to some of the most remote rivers in North America. It's a 1,500 km, 63- day mission to truly discover the secrets of the north and to show the world why some places are worth preserving before they are changed forever. Paradise Waits (special edit)
(2015, USA, 7 min)
Filmmakers: Teton Gravity Research
www.tetongravity.com
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory How do you celebrate winter when snow finally falls? Freeskier Tim Durtschi takes tram laps at Jackson Hole and big mountain skier Angel Collinson rips up some Alaskan lines.

results.description:
In this mixed class we get together and explore inner peace, and self empowerment. Let's get grounded: lets get high. 

We will use the faculties of our BBB's, Bodies, Brains & BREATH through the art of Yoga, QiGong, Pranayama and guided Meditation. Come breath into balance, grove into motion, and relax into stillness; with good music and positive energy, in a relaxed and intimate atmosphere (6 people). Come experience this unique integration and how it can light you up, and have you feeling both peaceful and EMPOWERED! 

Come with a yoga mat 

A clear intention 

And an open heart

I intend to hold this Meetup on an ongoing basis, Tuesdays & Thursday evenings with an energy exchange of $20, But check out your first one FREE

important Note:***Please do not use strong, unnatural perfumes or soaps as some participants are allergic! Thank You! ****

I look forward to serving and empowering you to live a happier, more peaceful and effective life, as we form our mindful community.

Om Namaha Shivaya 

Peace,

Serena

results.description:
SAFE BOATING COURSE

8 weeks-2 hours/week class

Hosted by the

Westchester Sail and Power Squadron

The United States Power Squadrons Safe Boating course is designed to familiarize you with most of the fundamentals of safe boating.

(12-16 year olds with parent or guardian)

Subjects covered include:

• Boat Handling

• Boat Types & Terminology

• Boating Regulations

• Navigational Rules

• Lines and Knots

• Adverse Conditions

• Emergencies

• Charts

• Aids to Navigation

• PWC

• Marine Radio Usage

• Trailer Boating

• PWC CERTIFICATION

The course meets the educational standards of the National Association of State Boating Law Administrators. Includes an examination as required by many states and insurance companies.


Date: Tuesday January 19, 2016

Time: 7:30 P.M. Registration 7:00 pm

Location: New Rochelle Marina (2nd floor classroom)

22 Pelham Road, New Rochelle NY

8 WEEK CLASS, meets on Tuesdays 7:30 to 9:30 pm

For further information and RSVP call:
Frank at:[masked] OR

$65 Fee for Materials

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Please join Carole Brill and Julie for an evening of chanting, prayers and meditation as we open our hearts to receive the blessings of Quan Yin.  Following the meditation will be a 60 minute Reiki share. All are welcome to receive!


Quan Yin is the Goddess of Compassion and is the manifestation of the Divine Mother and serves humanity in the same way as Mother Mary. She is a being of wisdom who is destined to Buddhahood by vowing to release all suffering through her mercy, compassion and healing. Quan Yin in all her forms is meant to inspire a supreme state of consciousness of compassion and mercy for self and ALL beings. 

Healing prayers and meditation will focus on opening the petals of the heart chakra.
results.name: The Gifts of Quan Yin with Chanting, Prayers, Meditation and Reiki Healing

Dumbo Comedy returns Tuesday, March 1 at 7:30pm with live music followed by a great lineup of standup comics.

Join us as Dumbo Kitchen hosts the event and has some great drink specials! They have a great selection of beer on tap including beers from Brooklyn's own Other Half Brewery. The show is free so come early, grab a bite and a drink and then enjoy some music and comedy.

Is it possible to have too much Origami? In the world of OMG never!

results.description:
West Caldwell, N.J. – Men of all ages are invited to participate in free singing lessons provided through the Dapper Dans of Harmony, Essex County’s premiere men’s chorus.
Ready, Set, Sing! Will be taught by the members of Gimme Four; an Internationally Competitive quartet; ranked in the top twenty in the world and members of the Dapper Dans of Harmony.
Give us six Tuesday evenings, and we’ll give you the skills you need to experience all the fun of solo or group singing.
Classes run Tuesdays at 7:30 p.m. for one hour each from March 1, 2016 until April 5, 2016 at the West Caldwell Civic Center, 5 Fairfield Ave, West Caldwell, NJ 07006. Singers of all skill levels and experience are invi...ted and all learning materials are free.
You don’t even need to be able to read music, we will teach you everything you need to know to sing richly and with resonance to produce ear-pleasing harmony. Our participants will quickly be producing beautiful harmony without the aid of a piano and in the company of a great bunch of fellow singers.
Everyone sings; whether it is in church, in the car, or in the shower, people have a natural desire to express themselves in song. However, many of us are unsure about singing in front of others. Through this program, the Dans want to help men get the most beautiful sound possible from their voice.
Advance registrations are appreciated, while walk-ins will be welcome. Contact the group at[masked] or [masked] to register or for more information.
The Dapper Dans of Harmony are part of the 24,000-member Barbershop Harmony Society and meet Tuesdays at the West Caldwell Civic Center and new singers are always welcome. Go to dapperdans.org to learn more about the group.
Ready, Set, Sing!
What: Free singing lessons courtesy of the Dapper Dans of Harmony
Where: West Caldwell Civic Center, 5 Fairfield Ave., West Caldwell NJ. Just look for the big clock!
When: Tuesdays at 7:30 p.m. from 3/1/16 until 4/5/16
To register please contact us at[masked] or [masked].
results.how_to_find_us: West Caldwell Civic Center Fairfield Ave in West Caldwell NJ
results.name: Ready, Set, Sing

results.description:
Come on out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills at a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

We will have a special section set aside for CRC members and friends at The Firehouses normal Team Trivia Night.  Make sure you let your host know that you wish to sit with the CRC teams when you arrive.


Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. Pay as you go for food and drink. Separate checks no problem. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round!

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stay and socialize and others head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.
results.name: Fun & Easy Rotating Team Trivia Night- Free

results.description:
Come on out to the Tara Hill Irish Tavern for a bluegrass jam.

This jam is for all level of players. There will be a mix of traditional instruments and any uke players who come from this group.

Bring a song to share. It's best if you have at least some printouts of the music. Traditionally at a bluegrass jam people take turns leading the songs. If you don't have any bluegrass songs other country or folk songs fit too. If you don't have a song or don't want to lead, that's ok too. In case you were thinking that you don't play much bluegrass, come anyway! Most bluegrass is pretty easy to play. The plan is to do these jams every first and third Tuesday of the month.

Email me for more info: [masked]

See you there!

results.description:
Here is a unique opportunity to join a healing group that meets regularly to support your needs using the amazing potential of Tapping.

There will NOT be a lot of discussion or socializing because we will be too busy Tapping on specific and general issues of our Emtional and Physical concerns using EFT and something called Tong Ren.

EFT is well known for eliminating the causes of emotional distress. Many people are also aware of using EFT for physical well being. Sometimes we need to look at the emotional aspects that may be behind the issues of concern, and sometimes we just tap directly on the symptoms and notice if we get relief just from that. Its very nice when this happens and it happens a lot.

Tong Ren is another form of healing using tapping but unlike EFT it doesnt involve any dialog to describe the issues of concern. We just tap on a surragate model (Tong Ren) as if we were doing acupunture on a real body with intention of healing and it works!!!!

We'll meet at Jain's home in Scarsdale every 2nd and 4th Tuesday evening and whoever is interested in joining us is welcome. The only stipulation is that whatever issue you bring to our attention you let us tap on it.
results.name: Tapping Meetup for Emotional and Physical Healing with EFT and Tong Ren

group.name: Emotional Freedom Discussion and Healing Group, White Plains

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
It's that time again! Let's meet and talk about the current state of the sub, and what you can do to help push it to our first milestone-- a tethered teleop run in a safe body of water, whether that's a pool or lake. We'll take data from the thrusters to help us model them more accurately. We'll gather scientific and cinematic camera data, so we can get a feel for how that looks underwater as well.

Everyone has skills, so even if you don't know about robotics, join us for a drink or two. We'll teach you along the way if you want to learn! The projected date for our maiden voyage is still spring/summer. Join up now to be part of the action!

Sean

results.description:
"Dating, Sex, Relationships and Marriage- The Ultimate LIVE Dating Q&A"
with Relationship Coach, and Author Roy Biancalana

FREE Pre-Dating Teleseminar

WHEN: Tuesday, March 1st, 2016 from 8:30 PM to 9:45 PM (ET)
SPEAKER:with Relationship Coach, and Author Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating Speed Dating C.O.O. and Relationship Coach, Michael Clarke
WHO'S INVITED: This Teleseminar is Open to EVERYONE
HOW MUCH: Complimentary!
HOW TO RSVP: http://predatingteleseminar.eventbrite.com

"Dating, Sex, Relationships and Marriage- The Ultimate LIVE Dating Q&A"

with Relationship Coach, and Author Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating Speed Dating C.O.O. and Relationship Coach, Michael Clarke

In this crazy new world of dating, we know you have tons of questions that need answering! So, we're taking a different approach on March's Teleseminar, as we have realized that you, the audience, want to ask questions on an array of different subjects and topics! Instead of our typical 45 minute guest speaker presentation, this month- Relationship Coach Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating C.O.O., Michael Clarke will answer your questions directly through a constructive and informative seminar built to help you succeed in finding a lasting, emotionally and physically fulfilling relationship.

What you need to do to be fully prepared:

Write down a few questions that you would like to have answered, no questions are off the table!

Bring an open-mind

And that’s it!

PLUS RSVP NOW TO GET THESE BONUSES:

Deep discounts on Pre-Dating Speed Dating Events

30 minute Free Coaching Session with Roy Biancalana

Raffle for Free Dating Events

Raffle for 1 of 5 Free Books from Roy Biancalana

Free access to Roy's "The Attraction Factor" Video Series

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS - Author Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating Speed Dating C.O.O. and Relationship Coach, Michael Clarke:

Roy Biancalana is known as "The Intimacy Guru," and is a nationally recognized leader in the field of attraction, intimacy and conscious relationships. He appears regularly on Fox35 TV in Orlando, FL as their relationship expert and is the author of the book, "A Drink with Legs" sold worldwide.

Roy is a certified relationship coach, spiritual teacher and was a PGA Tour player. His passion is working with men and women who are committed to awakening to their true spiritual nature and experiencing the love life they most desire. He specializes in supporting single people in attracting the love of their lives and also helping those who are in committed partnerships experience a deeper level of intimacy. He has clients all over the world and coaches by phone, Skype or in person.

Michael Clarke has been working with singles over the last 8 years on both the business end of two of the largest singles companies in the world as well as one-on-one through his coaching business. Michael's main focus within his coaching is to help people absolve any past relationship struggles, and to help his clients turn thier focus on themselves and how to be the very best person they can be before stepping back out into the dating scene.

Michael has been interviewed on dozens of radio stations, including "Date Therapy with Dr. Tranquility", "The Dating Jungle Live" with Tara Richter, as well as Tampa Bay's Fox News, and many others.

Missed a past teleseminar? Recordings available at http://www.pre-dating.com/teleseminar/

REMEMBER:

If you somehow can't make the call, everyone who RSVPs will receive access to the recording replay and bonuses in a follow-up email after this free teleseminar.

**Although this a FREE teleseminar, standard long distance charges may apply. Listeners may listen online as well, an online audio link will also be supplied when you RSVP.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Click Here for a Free Online Webinar: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewJersey

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation- 

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

results.description:
Are you looking to grow your business?

Would referrals be helpful for you in growing your business?

BNI Crossroads Chapter is comprised of local business professionals who meet regularly in a positive and supportive business environment, to strengthen relationships in the local business community - and to help one-another through the exchange of warm referrals and relationship introductions.

Having a long-standing foundation of business contacts in the community creates a continued "pipeline of referrals" - even when the economy is weak. People will still continue to do business with - and refer people - that they know, like and trust.

The group is an exclusive category referral network, and only allows one person per professional classification to participate over extended time periods.  If you are the best candidate in your field, we would like to meet you at an upcoming meeting.

Come once, and bring a thick stack of business cards with you.  Grow your local contacts, and gain more visibility in the local business community.  

We look forward to meeting you at an upcoming meeting, and learning more about your business. 

RSVP now and come promote your business at one of our upcoming meetings! 


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on March 2nd and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
I can't go to this meeting as it interferes with my work schedule. However I am posting the link to sign up (you do need to register to gain access to the talk). Anyone can go and it is not a formal meetup, just an announcement of professional development opportunities in the city ! Monthly clinical connection meetings at Hazelden are Addiction focused. Here is the description of the speaker and topic. I have gone to events with Bonnie Owen's as the speaker before and she is EXCELLENT. If anyone has an interest in treating first responders and working with PTSD/Trauma in addition to addiction issues this is a good talk to go to. I believe you get hours for SW's as well and it is FREE- see below. NYC Clinical Connection March Meeting
Please join us for our educational presentation and networking meeting. "The Intimate and Destructive Relationship Between Trauma and Addiction"

This workshop will explore the relationship of earlier life experiences, including the dynamics of generational addiction within a family system, using the lenses of Trauma informed care. Highlighting the manifestation of symptoms and the devastating and destructive relationship of addiction and trauma. Presented by: Bonnie E Owens, LCSW, CASAC, C-CATODSW, EMDR part 2
Director of Seafield Center's Honor and Resiliency Program Wednesday, March 2,[masked]:30 Registration & Networking
9:00am-11:00am 2 Contact Hours
(For Social Workers)

At:
Hazelden Chelsea
322 Eighth Ave., 12th Floor
(entrance on 26th St.)

About Our Speaker: Bonnie Owens, LCSW, CASAC, ICADC, EMDR PART 2 has been in the mental health and addictions field for over 25 years and she has been in full time private practice for 13 years, with offices in Freeport, NY and Shinnecock Hills, NY. She is currently the Director of Seafield Center's Honor and Resiliency Program: "A Trauma and Recovery Program: Dedicated to Uniformed Service Members.

As a degreed recreation therapist, Bonnie brings her unique blend of the mind-body connection to her treatment modalities. Her specialties are the psychobiology of trauma, PTSD, mood disorders and EMDR. Bonnie is the creator of a unique and specialized Brain Body Psychotherapy Trauma Technique, "KAYAKTHERAPY"™. Seafield Center Inc., SW CPE is recognized by the New York State Education Department's State Board for Social Work as an approved provider of continuing education for licensed social workers #0070.


Future NYCCC Meetings
Wednesday, June 15, 2016
"DBT: A review of the clinician's role and how to apply the principles to any treatment modality." By:
Lindsay Chester, LMSW ,CASAC-T, Intake Coordinator, Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation's
Young Adult Intensive Outpatient Program There is a limited amount of seats available, so please RSVP for the March training by clicking on the link below:

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
Join the Building Energy Exchange (BEEx) for their new Gallery Talk series, which marries technical presentations from industry experts with the interactive content of their Lighting the Future advanced lighting exhibit. These lunch-time sessions will guide attendees on configuring, selecting and installing the most advanced lighting, shading, and control systems available, and how those systems can maximized convenience, savings, and flexibility. 

- Click Here to Register - 

This is the first in a four-part Gallery Talk series which will utilize its Lighting the Future interactive exhibit as a classroom. The sessions will also draw lessons and data from the Living Lab Demonstration Project, a joint program with Lawrence Berkeley National Lab which deploys and monitors advanced lighting and shading systems in working offices to document the components and processes that lead to successful lighting and shading retrofits. 


SPEAKERS

Andrew Gross, Crestron
Adrian Howitt, Fluxwerx Illumination

SCHEDULE

11:30 Registration & Coffee
12:00 Welcome, Introductions
12:05 About the Living Lab and the Lighting the Future
12:15 Presentations
12:45 Moderated Discussion and Q&A
1:00 Guided Exhibit Tour

A moderated Q&A discussion will follow the presentations, and a guided tour of the exhibit will round out the event.

- Click Here to Register -
results.name: Gallery Talk: Convenience & Flexibility in Lighting Systems (BEEx Event)

results.description:
G'day everyone!


We have been invited to an event hosted by the ASX, DLA Piper and Moelis & Co to learn about the opportunities available to entrepreneurs in accessing equity funding in the Australian capital markets.

After the session there will be an opportunity to network and meet the presenters if you wanted to learn more about potentially taking this path with your business.

To attend this event, please RSVP on Meetup as attending and obtain your ticket here: 

https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/asx-comes-to-new-york-ipo-capital-raising-forum-tickets-20910868972

There are a number of US based start-ups that have successfully listed on the ASX and raised capital on this platform as opposed to taking venture capital.

I understand this event is not for everyone, but given a lot of the DUNY members are entrepreneurs, I thought it was worth sharing nonetheless.

Please feel free to share the event with your friends and colleagues.

I look forward to seeing you there!

Michael

results.description:
The New York City Economic Development Corporation (NYC EDC) and B Lab have launched the Best for NYC program to celebrate and support businesses that positively influence their workers, their community, and the environment. Participants are asked to take the "challenge" and fill out a brief survey about their business practices. Those who participate will be recognized by the city in an online and print directory, and will have access to special events and other benefits.

In this workshop, the EDC will present details about the program and guide participants through the process of filling out the challenge. By the end of this workshop, we hope that everyone attending will be signed up and eligible for the program. 

Goodnik and NY CSR Meetup have partnered with the Impact Hub NYC , the Centre for Social Innovation, and Be Social Change to host these workshops because because we support and promote socially responsible business practices and want to encourage all our members to do business in a better way. You don't need to attend the workshop to take the challenge - take it on your own today!

TAKE THE BEST FOR NYC CHALLENGE


Special benefits for NYCSR members who take the challenge;

• A "service grant" of 100 goodnikels, to be used for 10 hours of professional services at Goodnik.net.

• Free tickets to Be Social Change events and 20% off BSC classes through March 15, 2016

• One week of free coworking at the Centre for Social Innovation or Impact Hub NYC for non-members

• Exclusive events and parties • Inclusion in ‘Best for NYC’ Guide (print & digital), reaching 150,000+

• Exclusive events and services

• The opportunity to be featured in citywide awards and press*

• Membership in a vibrant networking community

• Ability to use ‘Best for NYC’ participant logo

• Tools to benchmark performance and create improvement plans
results.name: Partner Event: Best for NYC Workshop

results.description:
Watch us at LIVE at Adorama in person, or tune in online at PhotoBrigade.com/LIVE! 

Drew Gurian is a New York City based portrait photographer, focusing on the intersection of photography and music culture. His ability to seek out and capture raw, intimate moments is what defines his style. His personal aesthetic has translated seamlessly to brands like Red Bull and Reebok, and has garnered the attention of editorial clients like The Associated Press, Rolling Stone Magazine, VICE and The New York Times. Drew has spent the last ten years traveling the world with his camera, is accustomed to working with productions of all sizes, working quickly under pressure, and staying within budget to deliver memorable and emotionally charged imagery of celebrities in and out of the spotlight. He got his start in the industry traveling the world with world-renowned photographer, Joe McNally for five years, as his first assistant and right-hand man. Logging close to half a million miles in the air, he assisted Joe with client shoots, workshops and conferences around the world, working with tens of thousands of people. DrewGurian.com

Biography: 

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/PhotoBrigade_HEAD%5B1%5D.jpg?itok=bKADUApv

The Photo Brigade is an amazing blog and resource for freelance photographers that showcase the amazing work of their talented network of photographers through features, guest posts, gear reviews, and podcasts, on the business of photography.

results.description:
This week's call is completely FREE! Simply send an email to [masked] saying "attending free webinar" and you'll receive an access code! 

Do you want to travel the world but something's been stopping you, such as lack of time and money?

Do you desire a loving and passionate relationship but have trouble attracting the right person?  

Do you find that your thoughts and emotions are getting in the way from achieving joy and fulfillment?

The good news is that I'll be discussing HOW to achieve the above, and will be guiding you through a POWERFUL visualization process that has been scientifically proven to work miracles (no pun intended).

Anyone whose ever joined us on this webinar has had a truly profound and heart felt experience. 

Can't wait to share with you! 

Xox, 

Ayelet 

Testimonials from previous Life Transformers: 

"While attending Ayelet's webinar we were guided through a visualization technique to create the best version of who we will become in 10 years from now. In the middle of that awesome visualization I felt a burst, a huge leap of energy expanding in my heart chakra (and since I am an energy healer it makes so much sense). Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. I can feel at ease knowing I have this new tool in my hands, it's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I wanted to first thank you for hosting this. I have been doing a lot of things, such as the law of attraction, access consciousness, and yoga, and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I love how you said to write down all your thoughts/ lists about yourself, as well as goals, to see where the conflicts lie. I haven't really come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a free Lust to Love Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

Ayelet (www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron) is a relationship expert. I asked for her advice regarding my recent breakup with my boyfriend of six years, which is why I went to her event. Ayelet explained that we have a tendency to constantly chase guys who don't treat us right, and we have expectations of other people that in turn, create unhappiness in our lives. Working on the root chakra helps us let go of those expectations and find inner peace.

The meditation event helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The free meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC

Watch us at LIVE at Adorama in person, or tune in online atPhotoBrigade.com/LIVE! There will also be a podcast recorded prior to Alicia at 4PM with music and celebrity photographer Drew Gurian and you're all welcome to attend! 

Alicia Hansen has worked as a professional photographer for over 20 years. She has worked for The Atlanta Journal Constitution, The Seattle Times, The Springfield State Journal-Register, The Roanokke Times and World News, The Athens Banner Herald, The Guardian, and Fortune magazine. Alicia's editorial and corporate clients include, Sports Illustrated, Health Magazine, Golf Digest, PEOPLE, Amway Corporation, Bloomberg News, Tishman, Corporation, and Mark Burnett and Donald Trump's show "The Apprentice". She has a BA in Journalism from the University of Georgia and a Masters Degree in Visual Communication from Syracuse University's Newhouse School. Alicia founded and serves as execturive director and program designer for NYC SALT, a nonprofit that provides photography programming and mentoring to underserved teens in New York City. She has also participated in the Eddie Adams Workshop for over eight years. AliciaHansen.com

results.description:
￼“Collective Song Club” Meets every other Wednesday – 5:30-8:30PM

Location: Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com)

244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session.

The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter.

There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you!  All first time guests can come without becoming a full Collective member. After your first MeetUp - an  annual membership fee is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage!

.
results.name: The "Collective Song Club" presented by the New York Songwriters Collective

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will ever experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about, plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a couple blocks away.

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment!

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com
results.name: After Work Happy Hour & Social Networking Party ~ Free Event

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Welcome to Drupal NYC!

Please join us on Wednesday, March 2nd for our monthly meetup meetup at 30 Rock! 

We have an exciting lineup this month just for beginners! If you just started or are thinking about using Drupal, we're here to show you how it's done!

You must enter your real name on the RSVP question or your RSVP will be removed. Check-in opens at 6pm sharp, see you on March 2nd!

Agenda
• 6:00 - Check-in opens, socializing + pizza sponsored by NBCUniversal
• 6:30 - Announcements
• 6:45 - Who's hiring, who's looking?
• 6:50 - Presentations begin!
• 8:20 - Closing Remarks, socializing + leftover pizza
• 8:45 - After party sponsored by Fastly @ Bill’s Bar & Burger (1 block north, 16 W. 51st St., accessible via Rockefeller Concourse) https://goo.gl/maps/Eghs2

Presentations


==========

A Beginner's View of Views with Views in Your View by Alexander Ross

This talk will go through how you can use views to dynamically create lists of content. I’ll explain the ins and out of one of the most complicated UIs in all of Drupal-dom and inso doing, I’ll unlock the power of views to make your site filled with awesome. This talk is ideal for beginners however I will touch on a few more intermediate concepts and pro-tips.

Bio:
Alexander Ross is the Director of Software Engineering for CMS at NBCUniversal. This fall his Drupal.org profile turns 10 years old. With the exception of writing cover letters, Alex hates writing bios more than anything else in the world.

==========


Pro Drupal Development Crash Course by Jon Pugh

Take a wild ride through the day of your typical professional Drupal developer. Learn basic concepts like “modules”, “git”, and “tarballs”, tools of the trade, and overviews of blocks, node types, and more. You will walk away with an idea of what it takes to build any drupal site.

Bio:
Jon Pugh is the President & Cofounder of OpenDevShop Inc: a new company providing tools and support to make web development, testing, and hosting easier. Their flagship product, OpenDevShop, is an open source Platform-as-a-Service for Drupal. For more information please visit GetDevShop.com. You can find him at drupal.org/u/jon-pugh and @jonpugh.


========== 


Drupal 8: New, Different, Better and Why You Should Care by Ray Saltini

Find out why everyone’s talking about Drupal 8 and how it can improve everything you do on the web. Drupal 8 may not look that different on the surface but fundamental changes in it’s design promise tremendous advantages for marketeers and IT professionals alike. We’ll review the status of contributed modules and how you can figure out if Drupal 8 is right for you.

Bio:
Ray Saltini is an active member of the Drupal community since 2005 as a developer, business owner and more recently as Director of the FFW Center of Excellence.

==========


Want to present at Drupal NYC?!
We are always looking for new talks and speakers from all skill levels. If you are interested in presenting at Drupal NYC please message Ben Jeavons, our Speaker Organizer, @ http://www.meetup.com/drupalnyc/members/6722489

Accern Vigilant: Visual Social Analytics For Finance

Accern officially launches Vigilant to the financial service industry. Vigilant uses proprietary NLP and machine-learning models to scan over 20 million news and blog sources in real-time and actively alerts you on critical events that could affect your stocks. Advanced visual analytics such as word cloud, treemap, and sentiment charts are integrated into the platform, along with sophisticated visual filtering capabilities to drill down into stories that matter. 

Attendees of this event will have the opportunity to participate in our exclusive early adopter discount along with a chance to win 1-year of free access to Accern Vigilant.

results.description:
Get out of the cold and onto the ice!

Enjoy one last round of ice skating in iconic Central Park with your fellow JOCers followed by an option for a bite to eat or hot drinks together afterwards.

ORGANIZER: Nachi Winkler

COST: $11.25 entry, $8 skate rentals (see website regarding lock rentals fee)

Best Entrance: Use Central Park South (59th St) & 6th Avenue. Wollman Rink is a two minute walk into the park from this entrance. Follow the footpath directly into the park.


rink information and rates:

http://www.wollmanskatingrink.com/

THE PLAN

The game plan is to arrive anytime between 6 and 6:30 PM (you can arrive later if you need to) to meet up at reception, check in with me, and rent skates; hit the ice and skate until around 8:30; return skates and meet again by around 8:45; and walk together to anywhere nearby we can buy snacks/drinks and hang out together for a bit (until around 10 PM at the latest).

IMPORTANT FRIENDLY TIPS

- Do leave the extra baggage at home.  That means avoid bringing backpacks, briefcases, lunch boxes, etc. so that you will be able to fit your shoes and any minimal accessories you have into one locker.

- If you have your own lock bring it.

- It is unsafe to skate with any type of bag on, including backpacks, so plan accordingly.

-Do bring anybody who you wouldn’t be embarrassed to be seen with in public. Just make sure each person registers individually via the Meetup page.

For more information about the venue visit:

http://www.wollmanskatingrink.com/

I hope you can join us!

Nachi Winkler

Find solution to pressing problems. Learn alternate ways to solve problems. Build confidence with this tool. Learn ways Excel is used in other businesses. Network with other professionals

Solutions to Your Excel problems

Shortcuts & Best practices

Small business owners, accountants, controllers, auditors, financial planners,  financial analysts, budget analysts, bookkeepers, cost estimators, new managers, students, jobseekers

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Wednesday March 02,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

Evaluate for Change’s 6-week Introduction to Measuring Your Impact for Social Sector Professionals course is for individuals interested in learning the skills needed to become data-driven and results-oriented.

===========================================

This is a paid course. Space is limited -- be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCEFCMar2

=========================================== 

Knowing how to effectively measure the impact of your work in the social sector enables you to powerfully tell your story to donors and stakeholders alike, as well as constantly improve the services you offer. Whether you are looking to advance your career or focus on helping your current organization become stronger, you will leave with the skills you need to measure your impact.

All 6-week courses will be conducted through hands-on activities, out-of-class assignments, and readings. Using a small class size model ensures that all students get one-on-one time with trainers. Students should expect to spend 2-3 hours each week outside of class completing readings and assignments. This course is ideal for individuals with little to no evaluation and data experience. The six-week course covers the following topics in detail:

Week 1 (Mar. 2): Understanding the Power of Data Explore the broad reasons for engaging in evaluation in order to understand the power that data can deliver to your organization. This session provides students a high-level overview of the evaluation cycle. Learn why using data-driven practices are important and leave knowing how to articulate how the social sector can leverage data to measure their impact. 

Week 2 (Mar. 9): Assessment Phase & Logic Models Dissecting programs through a critical analysis helps to articulate the core components of any initiative, including inputs, outputs, and expected outcomes – also known as conducting a Logic Model or Theory of Change.  Determine what data you already track and what data still needs to be collected for each component. Explore the complementary aspects of regular data collection, and targeted, periodic evaluation.

Week 3 (Mar. 16): Transforming Programming into Measureable Outcomes & Outputs Want to make sure your measurement tools are as efficient as possible? First, you need to make sure you are asking the right questions. In this training, we start by breaking down your program’s purpose and mission. Throughout the process we train nonprofit professionals to be strategic when designing an evaluation. Participants will leave with a set of variables/indicators to be used in a survey or interview and discuss how they could be best measured.

Week 4 (Mar. 23): Designing Measurement Tools Using a Mixed-Methods Approach Sometimes, numbers can give you a good indication of how well an organization is doing, but it’s not always the whole story. Organizations need to also support evidence of their impact with humanizing stories and real-world anecdotes of how their program changes lives. Explore the complementary aspects of quantitative and qualitative research and be ready to address your own biases!  Learn about mixed methods approaches and how to develop measurement tools that actually capture the results you are looking to measure.

Week 5 (Mar. 30): Organizing, Managing, and Analyzing Data Once you have collected your data, the next step is to take it from raw data to aggregate results. It is imperative to value the methodologies of this process over simply obtaining advanced statistical technological programs. Learning how to handle your data and manage any pitfalls that occurred during the implementation phase will help you maximize the data you have collected.  This will also mitigate the effects of any less-than-perfect implementations. Learn more advanced methodologies to help you ensure your analysis is sound and impress stakeholders. 

Week 6 (Apr. 6): Storytelling Using Data Having aggregate data of your evaluation is not enough. This session will teach you how to craft this data in a format that effectively conveys your true impact. Understanding how to present your results to a variety of audiences ensures your efforts are communicated in the best light. Learn how to take your results to the next level by analyzing your audience and customizing your data to convince all stakeholders that you are making a real impact.

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/BX7ETbNlQjo0vlCzlzLnQ4yHqAUPLKQ8bTvsewbmHqjLLMIkHh7C6UawWUPPro7fuT1QJgkUs3k_qsDIbilLmCGNJ9nOinBQkjWf3MbCu_XFEtAFsQQOg-ktrGlyGeGKEkJ8uBg0

At Evaluate for Change, we are dedicated to shifting the social sector towards a more data-driven and results-oriented industry, all while remembering people are more than just numbers! We provide data and evaluation training exclusively to social sector professionals and organizations that are dedicated to making an impact in their community. We teach customized curriculum that leaves individuals and organizations with the skills needed to measure and prove their impact. Our model of teaching as opposed to doing, contributes to our larger mission of helping the social sector become self-sustaining. We do this by teaching the skills they need to succeed. All of our trainings are hands-on and interactive. Learn more about our unique training model here.
results.name: BSC Partner Workshop: Intro to Measuring Impact for Social Sector Professionals

WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

results.description:
FEATURED GUEST: Cheng Li
Sr. Fellow, Brookings, Dir. National Committee on U.S.-China Relations


Wednesday, March 2, 2016
6:00PM ~ 8:00 PM
Members: $20 Non-Members: $35

For questions, or membership inquiries please contact Tracey Huang at [masked] or[masked], ext. 105


Register Now!


Cheng Li is director of the John L. Thornton China Center and a senior fellow in the Foreign Policy program at Brookings. He is also a director of the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations.

Li grew up in Shanghai during the Cultural Revolution. In 1985 he came to the United States, where he received a master’s in Asian studies from the University of California, Berkeley and a doctorate in political science from Princeton University. From 1993 to 1995, he worked in China as a fellow with the U.S.-based Institute of Current World Affairs, observing grassroots changes in his native country. Based on this experience, he published a nationally acclaimed book, “Rediscovering China: Dynamics and Dilemmas of Reform” (1997).

Li is also the author or the editor of numerous books, including “China’s Leaders: The New Generation” (2001), “Bridging Minds Across the Pacific: The Sino-U.S. Educational Exchange[masked]” (2005), “China’s Changing Political Landscape: Prospects for Democracy” (2008), “China’s Emerging Middle Class: Beyond Economic Transformation” (2010), “China in 2020: A New Type of Superpower” (2011), “The Road to Zhongnanhai: High-Level Leadership Groups on the Eve of the 18th Party Congress” (in Chinese, 2012), “In the Name of Justice: Striving for the Rule of Law in China” (2012), “The Political Mapping of China’s Tobacco Industry and Anti-Smoking Campaign” (2012), “China’s Political Development: Chinese and American Perspectives” (2014), “Chinese Politics in the Xi Jinping Era” (2015), and “Social Ethics in a Changing China: Moral Decay or Ethical Awakening?” (2015). He is currently completing a book manuscript with the working title “Middle Class Shanghai: Pioneering China’s Global Integration.” He is the principal editor of the Thornton Center Chinese Thinkers Series published by the Brookings Institution Press.

Li has advised a wide range of government, business and non-profit organizations on working in China. He is a director of the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations, a member of the Academic Advisory Group of the Congressional U.S.-China Working Group, a member of the Council on Foreign Relations and a director of the Committee of 100. Before joining Brookings in 2006, he was the William R. Kenan professor of government at Hamilton College, where he had taught since 1991.

Li has been a recipient of fellowships or research grants from the Smith Richardson Foundation, the Freeman Foundation, the Peter Lewis Foundation, the Crane-Rogers Foundation, the Emerson Foundation, the United States Institute of Peace, Hong Kong Institute of Humanities and Social Sciences and the Chiang Ching-Kuo Foundation for International Scholarly Exchange. From 2002 to 2003, he was a residential fellow of the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars.

He is frequently called on to share his unique perspective and insights as an expert on China. He has recently appeared on CNN, C-SPAN, BBC, ABC World News with Diane Sawyer, PBS NewsHour, Charlie Rose, Foreign Exchange with Fareed Zakaria and NPR’s Diane Rehm Show. He has been featured in The New York Times, The Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, Time magazine, The Economist, Newsweek, Business Week, Foreign Policy magazine and numerous other publications. Li is also a columnist for the Stanford University journal China Leadership Monitor. He is a regular speaker and participant at the Bilderberg Conference.

Affiliations:
21st Century International Review, member, editorial board
Asia Policy, member, editorial board
China Leadership Monitor, Hoover Institution, Stanford University, columnist
China’s Rising Leaders Project, National Bureau of Asian Research, co-chair, advisory committee
Committee of 100, member and co-chair, issue committee
Council on Foreign Relations, member
Institute of Current World Affairs, trustee
Journal of Public Management, member, editorial board
National Committee on United States-China Relations, member, board of directors
The China Report, India, member, editorial board

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will ever experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about, plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a couple blocks away.

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment!

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com
