results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group

We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

PANELISTS:


• Andrew Kennedy - Enterprise Account Executive @ Grovo

• Anjali Kundra - Co-Founder & VP of Ops @ Partender (and recent Forbes 30 and 30 winner) 

• Nik Pai - Co-founder & CEO of LiftMetrix

Scott Howard |[masked] | [masked]


Katharine Albritton |[masked] | [masked]

Alison Davis | [masked]

 #HoyaBreakfast

--------------------------------- BIOS ---------------------------------

Andrew Kennedy: is an Enterprise Account Executive at Grovo, a next-generation learning solution for today's workforce.  He has experience in finance from work at Bear Stearns, UBS, and Guggenheim Partners. He also has experience running sales at VC backed Savored (acuired by Groupon) as well as additional startup experience.  Andrew graduated from the University of Virginia's McIntire School of Commerce in 2004. For more about Grovo - press release.

-

Anjali Kundra: is Co-Founder and VP of Operations at Partender, a digital bar inventory management solution. She is also a recent co-recipient of a Forbes 30 Under 30 nod in the Food & Drink category.  She has been involved with Startup Weekend in Gainseville, FL for over 3 years. Prior to Partender she held roles as VP of Client Services at RoomSync, Freelance Copywriter for Splash Magazines Worldwide, and VP of Marketing at Youtorial. Anjali holds an MSE from the University of Florida - Warrington College of Business Administration.

-

Nik Pai: is Co-founder and CEO of LiftMetrix.  Prior to LiftMetrix Nik gained experience as Founder and CEO of SnakBlox a social media marketing platform, as Director of New Business Development at [212]Media, and as an Investment Banker at Deutsche Bank.  Nik is a BSBA graduate of Georgetown University.

- 

Jeff Reid: is a nationally-recognized and proven strategic leader in entrepreneurship, education, and business development. He launched and developed an organization entrepreneurially from inception to #1 national ranking. He has a strong national network in entrepreneurial development, higher education, and venture capital. He has exceptional interpersonal, communication, relationship-building, and team management skills. He has expertise in education/non-profit administration, fundraising, entrepreneurial networks, wireless telecommunications, professional services marketing and sales.

We are still holding our rally! Even though Entergy says that the tritium leaks never went higher than 1/10th of 1% of required levels and they are returning to near normal levels, (call[masked] for their message) we are still holding our rally,

Thursday, March 3, 2016 - 12:00 Noon - 1:00pm

Chambers & Centre St. NE of City Hall;
Trains #4 - 6; #1-3; A
We're asking Mayor de Blasio to protect our water - make sure to follow-up on these investigations and make sure our water supply is safe.

Gov. Cuomo has called on the Department of Health (DOH), the Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC), and the Department of Public Service to join the NRC in immediate investigations of these radioactive water leaks.
Sen. Schumer has also called for an Indian Point investigation. The leaks were first reported Feb. 6th. By Feb. 10th, they had increased by 80%, to 14,800,000 picocuries per liter.We still have not heard or seen results from any of these investigations and are still asking for an Independent Investigation.

Please join us on Thursday.

Thank you.
PEACE, Catherine PS - Please Bring Signs
Shut Down Indian Point Now!
results.name: RALLY!  Demand an Indian Point Investigation - Shut it Down!

Create. Capture. Convert. Email Marketing, Your Most Powerful Tool.

Design emails your readers will love!

TO ATTEND THIS EVENT YOU MUST REGISTER HERE

What You Will Learn: 

- The essential elements of creating emails that convert.

- Best practices for subject line copy and email design.

- 7 reader responses to a successful email campaign.

-Advanced tracking and reporting methods.  

Get more out of your email marketing efforts and use these best practices to increase the deliverability of your next email campaign. 

Featuring: 

Courtney Todd, Vice President of Marketing, Distribion 

Rebecca Visconti, Director, Digital Analytics, Vertical Nerve 

Sky Cassidy, CEO, ProspectDB

Why attend this webinar:

1. Get more out of your email marketing efforts

2. Use email best practices to increase the deliverability of your next email campaign

3. Learn advanced tracking and reporting methods

More information about the speakers:

Distribion - Courtney Todd - Vice President of Marketing - Twitter @Distribion

Courtney Todd brings over ten years marketing and communications experience to her role at Distribion. She specializes in B2B marketing and has worked in a range of industries including technology, luxury furniture manufacturing and healthcare. She holds an MFA from Columbia University in New York and a BA from Southern Methodist University in Dallas.

Vertical Nerve - Rebecca Visconti - Director of Analytics

Rebecca is a self-proclaimed tool agnostic analytics practitioner and consultant. She has experience with IBM Digital Analytics (Coremetrics), Google Analytics, Site Catalyst and Webtrends. Rebecca prides herself on being able to sit down and meet with any client, belonging to any industry vertical, with unique business objectives, goals, budgets, and development capabilities, and provide them with a recommendation on which analytics tool would be the best fit for their needs.

ProspectDB - Sky Cassidy - CEO

Sky Cassidy is a partner at ProspectDB and took over as CEO in 2015. Since graduating Sonoma State University in 2000 he has held management positions in both sales and marketing departments as well as working as a founder on several startups. Sky Cassidy lives in Los Angeles, California.

results.description:
Ms Kanni Wignaraja, Director, UN Development Operations Coordination Office (UN DOCO) will be discussing the SDGs from a global perspective at Columbia University. The UN Development Operations Coordination Office (UN DOCO) is the Secretariat and technical and advisory support unit of the UN Development Group (UNDG). It brings together the UN development system to promote change and innovation to deliver together on sustainable development. DOCO works under the leadership of the UNDG Chair and guidance of the UNDG. The team provides field evidence to inform policy, facilitates the achievement of shared results, and promotes excellence in UN leadership and coordination. The core objective is a relevant and impactful UN contribution to development.

Ms. Wignaraja has a wealth of experience in global, regional and country portfolios and inter-agency initiatives, and has served as UN Resident Coordinator and UNDP Resident Representative, Zambia, which is a Delivering as One self-starter country. Prior to being the RC of Zambia, she served as Director, Capacity Development Group, UNDP, New York; Co-chair of the UNDG Working Group on Capacity Development and Senior Policy Advisor, in the Bureau for Development Policy, New York. She was also UNDP Deputy Resident Representative in Viet Nam, and Chief of Asia-Pacific Regional Programmes.
results.name: listen to a UN presentation on the Sustainable Development Goals

results.description:
On March 3rd, AOL is hosting a company-wide Virtual Reality Summit in New York to announce its entry into the VR space, and to bring all of its senior managers and engineers up to speed on why VR is a revolutionary technology that AOL needs to be a part of. The afternoon portion of the event is being held for a VR fair that will be open to the general public. This is a chance for AOL employees to try VR technology first hand, and to meet the VR companies in the city. We'll have booths for our guests to show off their VR products, several Vive and Oculus demo-stations running, and Huffington Post will be making the rounds and interviewing both guest-companies and panelists.

AOL would like to invite the NYVR community to attend the VR fair portion of the event.  If you would like to come please RSVP.  YOU MUST PROVIDE YOUR FIRST AND LAST NAME.  RSVPS WITHOUT FIRST AND LAST NAMES WILL BE REMOVED.
results.name: AOL VR Summit

results.description:
Join the NJ LGBT Chamber on Thursday, March 3rd, at one of New Jersey's premier cultural institutions, the Montclair Art Museum, for their March First Thursday Night event.  It's an evening of art, culture and networking!

Museum admission is free.  Tour the MAM galleries from 5 to 9 p.m., to view their permanent collection and their current exhibitions:

American Visions: 1870–1940, Works from the Bank of America Collection.

A sweeping survey of American art at the turn of the 20th century, American Visions: 1870–1940 traces the emergence of a truly American style of painting by concentrating on regional artists’ colonies established across the United States.

The exhibition explores the ways in which local artists interpreted America’s rural, maritime, and urban spaces and portrayed daily life using the Impressionist devices of capturing the moment with brisk brushstrokes, a vibrant palette, and atmospheric effects.

The museum will be offering hourly gallery tours, live music and interactive entertainment and there will also be a cash bar provided by one of Montclair's premier restaurants.  

From 5pm to 9pm the LGBT Chamber of Commerce's board of directors will be there networking and helping you to make the business and social connections you need.  Just look for our table in the museum's rotunda.  

Parking is ample in the museum's parking lot and all adjacent streets.

Bring your business cards!  The Chamber will be raffling a free one-year membership, which will give you the exposure and connections you need in New Jersey's  LGBT business community to make your business a success.

                                 Become a member of the Chamber!

results.description:
This group isn't your typical 'networking' event:  Our focus is helping each other grow our businesses through mastermind/brainstorming.  We are building business through building relationships with each other, so we can help each other succeed.

Here is an example of a typical Mastermind meeting:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Mastermind: 4-5 individuals at about 8 minutes each (45 minutes)

6:30-6:45pm – Connection/Business needs requests (15 minutes)

6:45-7:00pm - Open networking (will sometimes go past 7pm if space allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.  We only have 12 chairs, so come early!

Please take a moment to read "About us" at the top left so you get to know what we're all about before you RSVP.
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the dedicated parking lot in the back of the building, off of Cook Ave., then walk to the front of the building and come in the lobby door.
results.name: Monthly Mastermind

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
